GDSC JIIT-62 is extremely excited to announce that the Core Team recruitment for 2024-25 has begun! 🥳 

We are keenly looking for driven, innovative, and enthusiastic people passionate about technology and the community that propels it forward. We strongly encourage students from 2nd and 3rd year to apply! 🎉

This is your chance to get directly involved with Google technologies, mentor other students in their journey in tech, and innovate with like-minded individuals in the GDSC team. 🚀

Apply Now! Link in bio. 🔗

https://forms.gle/WV3mruRmE3uWXXrP6

Deadline: August 18, 2024 🗓️

#gdscjiit #recruitingnow #developersstudentclyb #googledevelopersstudentclub #technology #innovation #connect #learn #grow #coreteam @jiit.official @googlefordevs

Proudly signing off with gratitude (and a tinge of nostalgia) ❤️

GDSC JIIT had a memorable run this year, its immense success attributed to the wonderful core team. Under the leadership of @paakhim10 🚀, facilitated by @aryaman__gupta, @iamsochirag, @harsh_1503_, @dhimanshu_02, @kaavyabaranwal, Ayush Gupta, @kukreja.devansh, @siddanth._.reddy, @ag_0080, and @bohomurphy in the technical team 👾, Tanish Goyal, @astha._.r, Ayush Gupta, @manas__2709, and @ilavanyajain in the management team 👥, and @simmran_agarwal, @bohomurphy, @manas__2709, and Tanya Singh in the creative team 👩🏻‍💻, GDSC brought together over a thousand students in its hackathons, workshops, and sessions, cultivating a culture of learning, coding, and development.

With a heart full of pride, we look forward to even greater achievements in the coming year! 🎉

This past year at GDSC JIIT has been nothing short of phenomenal! 🥳

Our journey began with a bang 💥 – the Internal Hackathon for SIH '23 in September! With a record-breaking 700+ registrations, this hackathon marked a new chapter in GDSC JIIT history. 🏆 With a goal of continued learning, we hosted the Cloud Study Jams 👾 in October, where our dedication earned us the prestigious Bronze Tier achievement. December saw the Android Development Camp take center stage, conducted entirely online with numerous enthusiastic participants joining both days. ‍ 

Then came the much-awaited Impressions 2024 in February, a whirlwind of exciting events. With Codecharades 🎭 on Day 1 and Chords & Clues 🎶 on Day 2, we saw a combined participation of over 180 JIITians eager to test their skills on our carefully crafted challenges. 

March and April witnessed our flagship event: Aspire 🚀. The Aspire Info Session was held in person in March with a remarkable turnout. We delved into exciting fields like blockchain, AI/ML, data science, and web development, and even launched the GoogleVerse segment! The momentum continued with the Aspire Hands-on Workshops in April, focusing on Data Science/ML and Web Dev. With over 100 participants attending in person, these workshops empowered students to gain practical experience. ‍👩🏻‍💻 

As we wrapped up the year in May, we proudly facilitated the Gen AI Study Jams, achieving the coveted Gold Tier 🥇. This accomplishment reflects our unwavering commitment to fostering a vibrant learning environment in our campus. 

The 2023-24 tenure for GDSC set numerous landmarks and brought forth new ideas — whether that be GoogleVerse in Aspire, the twist of bhailang in Codecharades, the use of Gemini in Chords & Clues, or the reels we launched in promotion of our events. We can't wait to see what the next year brings for GDSC! 🥳🚀

As we wrap up the academic year, let's go out with a bang! 🥳
With its extraordinary upskilling opportunities and outworldly swags, Google is launching its generative AI program for the first time — Gen AI Study Jams! 👾

Fill out the interest form now and get the chance to:

🟣 Learn about Generative AI and Google Gemini in just three stages of learning.
🟣 Free access to the Google Cloud Console.
🟣 Earn Google swags and official GDSC certificates for participation! 
🟣 Unlike Google Cloud Study Jams, this campaign is shorter (with 3 tasks, instead of 8), so learn quicker and win bigger!
🟣 Complete the tasks any time between May 1 and May 28 to be eligible!

Link in Bio!

Registration Link: https://forms.gle/43K81Fj5rZzE3GJg8
Registration deadline: April 25, 2024

Hurry up! Only the first 150 registrations will be counted! ⏰

The hands-on workshops are here! 

As told in Aspire 🚀, GDSC is here with our workshops on ML/ Data Science and Web Development, where our team will guide you step-by-step on making projects that will embellish your resumé and help you upskill!👾

Don’t miss out on this opportunity! We’ll cover everything right from the basics, so no prerequisites are required...just your laptops and a zeal to learn! 💻
See you there!🎉

Registration link 🔗: https://forms.gle/437wcB8TGLPafFr68

📆 Date : March 18-20 , 2024
🕗 Time : 5:00 PM onwards
📍 Location : CL-01

The possibilities are endless, just like the universe itself!🌌

GDSC is back again with Aspire, where we ignite your passion and dive into various career roadmaps in the tech field. Our hands-on workshops coming later this month will equip you with the knowledge and skills to make your mark in the ever-expanding tech frontier!

This session goes beyond just learning about technology. We'll be answering your questions about specific domains and providing insights into navigating college life as a tech student.👾📚

Here's what you can expect:

🌟AI/ML and Data Science
🌟 Web Development
🌟 Blockchain
🌟 GoogleVerse👽 (a surprise segment!)

Gear up for ASPIRE TO GROW! 🚀

📆 Date : March 5 , 2024
🕗 Time : 5:00 PM onwards
📍 Location : LT-2, ABB-1

RSVP: https://forms.gle/3TcFg5wLo6xqgB487

We, at GDSC-JIIT, are over the moon with our success in Impressions ‘24! 🎉🎬

With Codecharades 🎭 on Day 1 and Chords&Clues 🎶 on Day 2, we got a collective participation of 150+ JIITians, eager to try their skills and luck on our carefully curated questions and riddles! It was an extremely fulfilling experience for everyone involved, and we can’t wait to bring you more such exciting events!

Give me the clues, and I’ll tell you the song! 

GDSC JIIT in Impressions ‘24 brings to you Chords and Clues 🎶, an event that will requires you to enslave Bard into guessing a song using the clues you give it. Rules are a catch — but they will be revealed when you reach the venue!
Babumoshaai, aana mat bhoolna! 👾

📆: February 25, 2024
🕰️: 12-1 PM
📍: CL-05

🔗: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfdL_oLc3Ox3wiPlcUjn2TN8aQu2DunY_aO7QP5MHrv-O5tnA/viewform

#jiit #impressions24 #gdsc #bard

Bhai, bhai, bhai - gaana toh guess karo!🎶
GDSC with Impressions ‘24 brings to you Codecharades 🎭, an event that will task you with guessing songs and movies from code snippets! An exciting twist awaits you!
See you tomorrow!
📆: February 24, 2024
🕰️: 1 - 3 PM
📍: CL-04
🔗: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfdL_oLc3Ox3wiPlcUjn2TN8aQu2DunY_aO7QP5MHrv-O5tnA/viewform
P.S. Registration is individual but participation is in teams of 2-4!

#jiit #impressions24 #gdsc #code

Calling all student developers! Are you ready to tackle real-world challenges with the power of Google tech? The #GDSCSolutionChallenge2024 is ON!🚀

Let’s turn ideas into solutions and make a global impact.  Whether you’re passionate about AI, sustainability, healthcare, or any other field, there’s a challenge for you.

Here’s how you can get involved:

🔻Brainstorm about a UN goal you’re passionate about solving.
🔻Develop a creative and impactful solution using Google technologies.
‍🔻Form a team of like-minded developers and get coding!

Register for the challenge by January 20, and submit your project by February 22!

⭐️ Compete for the chance to win $3,000, Google swags, mentorship programs, and gain global recognition!

Don’t miss out on this opportunity to make a difference with your tech skills! Sign up for the #GDSCSolutionChallenge2024 today!

Link in bio! ➡️

#GoogleDevs #GDSC

We are here with our latest workshop on the basics of Android development where we'll build an app with you from scratch. Here's an opportunity for you to glorify your profile and learn something new!🚀📱
Register now! Link in bio!
🔗 https://forms.gle/JzBMyG2jpvX6HN7m6

We are excited to share that we are partnering with TFUG Ghaziabad @ TensorFlow:PowerUp! 🎉
We believe in the power of community, and we're all set to gather machine learning enthusiasts on November 4, 2023 in AKGEC College, Ghaziabad.👩🏻‍💻

The 2022-23 term for GDSC JIIT was an exhilarating journey filled with innovation, teamwork, and growth!🎉 

Having started with the Compose Camp in October, we successfully organized Hackin' Winters ❄️ with over 100 participants in November along with advanced workshops on various technical themes. We held the reputed ASPIRE program in the same month, which gathered hundreds of curious minds to kick off their journey in tech. The next semester was equally productive for the club. We conducted the Web Portfolio building in HTML & CSS for aspiring students in February and the Flutter Forward Extended program where we guided students in Flutter and Firebase in March. Along with that, we campaigned for the famous Google Cloud Career Practitioner program that got numerous students official Google swags 🤩.

Then came Impressions 2023 👾. While all of the core team at GDSC was excited to get their annual fest back, we knew we had a great opportunity to organize fun and innovative events for the students. Despite simultaneous non-technical events, CSS Smackdown and Bake A Cake were two of our most fascinating events that invited hundreds of participants to try their hands at web development and cryptography.

As we wrap up this term, here is a massive shoutout to our core team for making every event and campaign an unforgettable success! 🌟
Our hearts brim with excitement and curiosity as we kick off the new term! Stay tuned for even more fun and innovation!🚀🎉

#gdscjiit #developerstudentclubs  @googlefordevs #googledeveloperstudentclubs @jiit.official

WHAT DO WE DO? Participate in Hackathons😈

We all have attended events organized by GDSC, CICE, Graficas, GameDev, Ribose, but what if I told you that we all hubs decided to take our college events a step further!! 
Yes, you guessed it right, all the above-mentioned hubs have come together to bring to you A JIIT Hackathon: "HackInSummer" which aims to bring together our best coders, developers, designers, innovators, creators, and entrepreneurs of tomorrow. HackInSummer is geared up for those who are passionate about building, designing, and innovating.
It will be 3 days full of fun events, coding, development, jamming, and .....
This event has multiple sub-categories include webdev, blockchain and others. Special rewards have been made for you to win individually. Hope you’re doing well. 

Last year brought many challenges, but it also brought the drive to help each other and give back to our communities. 

With that in mind, Google is inviting university students to join the Google Developers Student Clubs 2021 Solution Challenge!

The mission of the challenge is to solve for one or more of the United Nations' 17 Sustainable Development Goals using Google technology. 

Submissions will be accepted up until March 31, 2021. 
Register here : https://developers.google.com/community/gdsc-solution-challenge

Finalists and top winners receive: 
- Customized mentorship from Google Developers 
- Chromebook
- 1-year subscription to Pluralsight
Swag and more! 

Resources available from Google:
- Live virtual sessions and Q&A
- Mentorship
- Custom codelabs, training videos and more!

#google  #technology #students #sustainabledevelopment #unitednations

crescendojiit.caption: “Introducing the Crescendo Volunteers 2024-25! 🎶 Ready to make waves, create memories, and lead us to new heights. Congratulations to all selected!”
“Introducing the Crescendo Volunteers 2024-25! 🎶 Ready to make waves, create memories, and lead us to new heights. Congratulations to all selected!”
“Introducing the Crescendo Volunteers 2024-25! 🎶 Ready to make waves, create memories, and lead us to new heights. Congratulations to all selected!”
“Introducing the Crescendo Volunteers 2024-25! 🎶 Ready to make waves, create memories, and lead us to new heights. Congratulations to all selected!”
“Introducing the Crescendo Volunteers 2024-25! 🎶 Ready to make waves, create memories, and lead us to new heights. Congratulations to all selected!”

🎶 Calling All Second-Year Music Enthusiasts! 🎶

Are you passionate about music and eager to make your mark in Crescendo? We are looking for dedicated volunteers for the year 2024-25! If you’re ready to contribute, learn, and be a part of our vibrant community, fill out the Google form in our bio.

Don’t miss this chance to join the hub and create unforgettable musical experiences together!

Meet Kunal Kishore, our former Management Head and a true cornerstone of our music society. As a talented guitarist and vocalist, Kunal has always been the driving force behind our events, ensuring everything runs smoothly. His dedication and leadership have been instrumental in shaping our society’s success, making him an invaluable asset to our team. We are thrilled to have Kunal as a Senior Advisor this year, continuing to guide us with his expertise and passion for music.

Say hello to Prerit Sharma, our former Marketing Head, who excelled in managing events with finesse. As a vocalist, Prerit’s dynamic presence brought energy and enthusiasm to our society. His adept handling of public relations and events made him an indispensable part of our team. We are delighted to have Prerit as a Senior Advisor this year, bringing his expertise and vibrant spirit to guide us forward.

Introducing Mihika Manuraj, our previous Administrative Head, whose soothing voice has enchanted us all. As a vocalist, Mihika’s calming presence was matched by her friendly demeanor, making her a beloved figure among her juniors. Her unwavering support and kindness have left a lasting impact, creating a nurturing environment within our society. We are excited to have Mihika as a Senior Advisor this year, continuing to inspire and support us with her warmth and experience.

Introducing Shambhavi Swaroop The PR Head Of Crescendo. She’s a music enthusiast with a soulful journey. Growing up, music was her solace, her confidant, and her driving force. From singing in the shower to performing on stage, her passion for music has only intensified with time. She’s explored various styles and genres, shaping her unique sound. Her musical journey has been a rollercoaster of creativity, self-expression, and personal growth. She’s grateful for the melodies that have filled her life with joy, comfort, and purpose. Music is her language, her escape, and her legacy.

Meet Shubhashri! A dazzling mezzo-soprano singer, who kicked off her musical journey with Rabindra Sangeet at the age of 4. With a boundless passion for both Indian and Western music, she’s a musical chameleon who can effortlessly switch genres. An artist and dancer too, she’s a whirlwind of creativity and charisma.Shubhashri’s friendly nature and gift of gab make her a magnet for connections, and her radiant smile is the secret ingredient to her comforting, captivating presence. Whether she’s belting out a melody or working the room, her infectious energy and networking prowess are simply unmatched!

“Meet Sushweta, often known as sushy. Ten years ago, she started her musical adventure with classical tunes. Along the way, she had her fair share of ‘oops’ moments, but she didn’t fret (pun intended). She took them in stride and learned from them. Whether she’s strumming a guitar or tinkling the piano keys, Sushweta’s musical journey keeps hitting all the right notes – and a few puns!” 🎵✨

(Note: She can yap about Hozier for hours, so be prepared for a lyrical lecture!)

Sreya Varghese is a passionate singer who fills her free time with the joy of exploring new songs and travelling to new places. Her hobbies include singing, listening to music, and engaging in spirited debates. Her love for music extends beyond performing, as she immerses herself in diverse genres, constantly discovering fresh melodies. Her adventures in travel enrich her life with unique experiences and cultural insights. With a vibrant personality and a heart full of melodies, Sreya’s journey through life is a harmonious blend of passion and adventure.

Meet Swastik. He is a multi-instrumentalist specializing in the flute, deeply connected to Lord Krishna, which is why the flute holds a special place in his heart. Music has always been an integral part of his life, serving as a source of inspiration and expression. Swastik’s passion for music extends beyond personal enjoyment; he thrives in team environments, where his collaborative spirit and ability to interact seamlessly with others shine. Whether performing on stage, coordinating events, or simply jamming with friends, Swastik brings harmony and enthusiasm to every endeavor. His dedication to music and teamwork reflects his commitment to creating meaningful and memorable experiences for everyone around him.

“Introducing Srivas Sundar, management lead at Crescendo: A talented vocalist and guitarist, he is deeply passionate about music. Known for his strong organizational skills, he excels in teamwork, exudes optimism, and performs with unwavering confidence.”

Meet Aryan, a dynamic drummer who started his musical journey at just 8 years old. Famous for his innovative shift from 4/4 to 3/4 beats during performances, Aryan never fails to surprise his audience. When he’s not behind his drum kit,you’ll find him dominating in Valorant or or exploring new anime series. Known for his friendliness and willingness to help others, Aryan boasts a playlist as diverse as his interests, filled with songs from various genres and languages. A true cinephile, Aryan’s enthusiasm for movies knows no bounds, constantly on the lookout for the next great film to dive into. ; )

Meet Gaurav, a cool dude. Always giving obscure movie recommendations. Has an almost predatory gaze while singing but is really just having trouble remembering the lyrics. When he sings though, his passion shines through. Picture him rocking out on stage with a killer performance, belting out those hard-hitting notes, even as he wrestles with the lyrics. Now that’s cool.

Meet Hitendra. Always fascinated with the guitar, he’s a self-taught guitarist and passionate about using music as his form of expression. From an awestruck child watching performances to giving them in college, he’s grateful for every opportunity. Hitendra’s music taste spans metal, rock, hip-hop, indie, and soft Bollywood, with a deeper love for indie and metal. He jokingly gatekeeps his favorite songs, so if he shares them with you, consider yourself as a bestie ;) For him, listening to music is a ritual, not a hobby. When “unemployed” (his term for free time), he’s either watching anime (ready to debate on a cliff’s edge) or playing lawn tennis. A social being, Hitendra loves interacting with others, always bringing a fun and smooth vibe to every conversation (+1000 aura)

Introducing Varun, with a voice that heals and a soul that sings. Varun isn’t just passionate about music—he’s a composer of melodies that stir the soul and a lyricist weaving stories that resonate deeply.Music isn’t just his passion; it’s his heartbeat. When he’s not captivating listeners with his voice, you’ll often find him turning everyday moments with his infectious Punjabi vibes!

Meet Shrankhala, a music enthusiast whose love affair with the guitar started in childhood and has been going strong ever since. For Shrankhala, the guitar isn’t just a bunch of strings and wood—it’s her trusty sidekick, helping her express feelings that even her best friends don’t always get. She’s dived headfirst into Hindustani music, becoming a true aficionado, and she’s the kind of musician who finds joy and fulfillment in jamming with bands and orchestras. When she’s not strumming away or dazzling audiences, you’ll find her geeking out over anime and exploring every music genre under the sun. Oh, and if you ever hear someone singing like they’re auditioning for a pop concert while playing guitar, that’s probably Shrankhala—because why settle for just one talent when you can serenade the world with both?

Abhinav is a passionate music producer and a multi-instrumentalist with an excellency in playing the keys. Being an avid Jazz, Mathrock, Hip-Hop, and EDM enjoyer, he’s knowledgeable and can riff on just about anything. Only blues he has in his life is the scale. 
As skillful as he is, also a fun guy when you get along. 

“Yo, can you clap to this?? *plays a 15/16 riff*”

We all deserve a chance to let our creativity flow when it has been trapped within the four walls of your room during this pandemic.
Crescendo: The Music Hub of JIIT brings all vocalists the opportunity to let themselves feel alive again during this pandemic with our event Acoustica. So, warm your chords and start sending us your videos from the 13th of June. For rules and regulations, click the link in bio.

Rules:

1. The online round of the contest starts from 13th June and will be open until 20th June, Sunday, 11:59 pm.
The participants need to send their videos which will be uploaded on the Instagram page of Crescendo. The
videos with maximum likes/shares/comments will be considered. Any video or
likes/shares/comments on the video will not be considered after the said date. Postponement of this round
beyond the last day, if any, will be notified on the page accordingly.
2. Participants can send their videos to the given WhatsApp number 8800371601 or 9811553966. In case
of any issue you can also mail your entries at jaypeemusichub@gmail.com along with the following
information:
a.) Name
b.) Name of College
c.) Year (1st, 2nd etc.)
d.) Contact Number
e.) Email ID
3. The time limit of the video is 1 minute, and the size must not exceed 50 MB. Videos failing to comply with
these limits shall not be entertained.
4. The following are the acceptable cases:
a.) Vocalist only (No background music)
b.) Vocalist with an instrument
c.) Vocalist with an accompanying instrumentalist
d.) Vocalist with karaoke
There cannot be two instruments involved.
5. The singer's face should be visible during the video, and the corresponding audio should be clear. Videos
with edited audios will not be entertained. Use of any kind of third party apps to increase the number of
likes/shares/comments will result in disqualification.
6. Likes/comments/shares will only be counted if the person liking the video has also liked the Facebook
page and followed the Instagram page.

Formed in 2016, this Haryana-based indie rock band has garnered immense popularity in quite a short span of time. Not fencing around one particular genre, the band for its cause of reaching out individualistically opens its brackets for Rock, Pop, Funk and Indian Classical. It plays in a broader spectrum and focuses on bringing in ambirnt tones and soulful feeling and not just technique. The band has also shone in various music fests and are a favorite for private gigs, university and college fests, cultural events, weddings, and so on. Check out their songs like ‘Main Zinda Hoon’, ‘Marne Ki Aadatein’, and ‘Mahakaal Aa Raha’ to experience the magic they weave through music yourself.

Hey guys!! Impressions 2020 is almost here, Crescendo- the music hub of JIIT is glad to announce the most awaited event "Voice of Impressions". VOI gives a platform to all the melodious singers to showcase their talent.
The online round is officially open!! .

Rules:
1. The first round i.e the online round of the contest starts from this moment onwards and will be open until 20th February, Thursday, 11:59 pm. The participants need to send their video which will be uploaded on the Facebook and Instagram page of Crescendo. The videos with maximum likes/shares/comments will be considered for the next round. Any video or likes/shares/comments on the video will not be considered after the said date. Postponement of this round beyond the last day, if any, will be notified on the page accordingly.

2. Participants can send their videos to one of these WhatsApp numbers 7004557966 or 8527367484 along with the following information:
a.) Name
b.) Name of College
c.) Year (1st, 2nd etc.)
d.) Contact Number
e.) Email ID

3. The time limit of the video is 1 minute 30 seconds, and the size must not exceed 30 MB. Videos failing to comply with these limits shall not be entertained. 
4. The following are the acceptable cases for both the rounds:
a.) Vocalist only (No background music)
b.) Vocalist with an instrument
c.) Vocalist with an accompanying instrumentalist
d.) Vocalist with karaoke
There cannot be two instruments involved.

5. The singer's face should be visible during the video, and the corresponding audio should be clear. Videos with edited audios will not be entertained. Use of any kind of third party apps to increase the number of likes/shares/comments will result in disqualification. 
6. Likes/comments/shares will only be counted if the person liking the video has also liked the Facebook page and  followed the Instagram page of Crescendo.

7. Participation from other colleges is allowed. 
So singers, warm up your pipes and send in your entries! 
We are waiting!

Hello everyone!!! With the fest around the corner, Crescendo brings you the Voice of Impressions-a stage to showcase your singing talent to the world.
The online round is officially open! 
Get ready to take part in one of the grandest events of Impressions 2K19!

Rules:
1. The first round i.e the online round of the contest starts from this moment onwards and will be open until 18 February, Monday, 11:59 pm. The participants need to send their video which will be uploaded on the Facebook page of Crescendo. The videos with maximum likes/shares/comments will be considered for the next round. Any video or likes/shares/comments on the video will not be considered after the said date. Postponement of this round beyond the last day, if any, will be notified on the page accordingly.

2. Participants can send their videos to one of these WhatsApp numbers 8130745989 or 8447705584 along with the following information:
a.) Name
b.) Name of College
c.) Year (1st, 2nd etc.)
d.) Contact Number
e.) Email ID

3. The time limit of the video is 1 minute 30 seconds, and the size must not exceed 30 MB. Videos failing to comply with these limits shall not be entertained. 
4. The following are the acceptable cases for both the rounds:
a.) Vocalist only (No background music)
b.) Vocalist with an instrument.
c.) Vocalist with an accompanying instrumentalist. 
There cannot be two instruments involved.

5. The singer's face should be visible during the video, and the corresponding audio should be clear. Videos with edited audios will not be entertained. Use of any kind of third party apps to increase the number of likes/shares/comments will result in disqualification. 
6. Likes/comments/shares will only be counted if the person liking the video has also liked the page.

7. Participation from other colleges is allowed. 
So singers, warm up your pipes and send in your entries! 
We are waiting!

jaypee.photo.enthusiasts.guild.caption:
It is with heavy hearts that we share the news of the passing of Bhavy Tripathi, a cherished member of our JPEG family. 
Bhavy's light, creativity, and passion for photography were truly unmatched. He had a unique way of capturing the world, and his work left a lasting impact on all of us. Beyond his incredible talent, Bhavy was a kind and inspiring presence, always lifting the spirits of those around him. 
Our thoughts and prayers are with his family and friends during this incredibly difficult time. 
Rest in peace, Bhavy. Your legacy will live on in every photo you took and every life you touched.

IMPRESSIONS’24 AFTERMOVIE🎥✨
Memories are the treasures we keep locked away within the storehouse of our souls. 
Reflecting on this year’s fest, our hearts overflow with gratitude and joy. Each moment was crafted with dedication, creativity, and the collective spirit of our amazing team. From the dazzling performances to the behind-the-scenes efforts, every detail spoke of our passion and unity. The laughter, camaraderie, and shared experiences truly defined the fest. 
Here’s to cherishing these beautiful memories and dreaming even bigger for the future.
.
.
🎥 FROM TEAM JPEG

.

Rules for Mr. And Ms. Photogenic'23 📢📢📢

Stay tuned for more information

Rules for PIXEL'23 📢📢📢

Stay tuned for more information

-Pixel is an exciting online photography competition that provides a platform for photographers of all levels to showcase their skills and creativity.

•Participants will be given a theme on the day of the event .Participants can interpret the theme in any way they choose, using their own unique vision and style to capture moments through their camera lens.

•Participants have to submit only their original work. They are allowed to edit the photos but have to submit both the raws and the edit for authenticity of the work.

•Entries to Pixel are judged on the basis of the technical and creative aspects of the photographs. The judges assess the quality, composition, lighting, and storytelling of the images to determine the winner. 

CASH PRIZE 🏆 : 5K
Best of luck enthusiasts 🤩

𝐌𝐫. & 𝐌𝐬. 𝐏𝐡𝐨𝐭𝐨𝐠𝐞𝐧𝐢𝐜
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
 Mr. and Ms. Photogenic competition is a highly anticipated event that celebrates the beauty and charisma of individuals through the art of photography. This competition is designed to showcase the contestants' ability to present themselves in front of the camera and capture their essence in a single snapshot 📸

•NOTE : During the competition, contestants are required to participate in a photo shoot session where they are photographed in outfits and poses of their choosing on a photo booth setup in front of the annapurna . The photographs are then reviewed by a panel of judges who evaluate the quality and creativity of the photos, as well as the contestants' ability to project their personalities and engage with the camera.

.COMPETITION HAS A CASH PRIZE OF ₹5k💰

BEST OF LUCK PARTICIPANTS 👍🏻

Hola amigos!
The photography hub of JIIT is inviting you guys to showcase your photography skills by capturing moments from all around YOU!
We are excited to announce our online photography contest 'KAPTURED' for the academic year 2021-22.

If you are willing to get a chance to become a highlight among your peeps, this is a fare chance for you! ;)

The Themes:
💛 Cine-Street ( Walk through streets with your camera)
💛 Vistas (capture beautiful views)

The Rules:
🔴 It should be your own Orignal work!
🔴 Participants need to fill the form and submit their photographs there only.
🔴 Participants need to post their photos on Instagram story and also use the ⚠️TAG⚠️ #jpegjiit in their post ( Only then it will be considered!) 
🔴Participants also need to tag us in their story.

🎊 There will be special feature for students of 1st and 2nd years.

🔷The winners(1st, 2nd & 3rd) will get a chance to get featured in our Instagram and facebook handles!! 

✨✨ FORM LINK IN BIO ✨✨

So peeps, gather your tools, keep a curious eye because moments don't occour often! ✨

HAPPY SHOOTING! 📸

Online Photography Competition!📸

Hey there,
Here's an opportunity for you guys to show up your skills by delivering exceptional standalone images! JPEG (Jaypee Photo Enthusiasts Guild), The Photography Hub of JIIT Sector 62 is hosting an "Online Photography Trivia". The Themes are follows:

•Festive (Capturing the heart-warming beauty of festivities)
•Creative (Get creative in the comfort of your home/ Photography at Home)
•Travel Diaries (Documenting the areas you've visited)

Rules:

•Participants need to post the picture in their stories, tagging our Instagram Page. They also need to send the picture via Email/WhatsApp)
•We'll be sharing all the pictures in our stories, and thus you need to tag our Instagram Page.
•Winner will be judged on the following criterion: Concept, Clarity, Resonance with the Theme & Story.
•The Winning picture will be posted on our Instagram Handle.
•MOBILE & DSLR PHOTOGRAPHY (Both are allowed)

Feel free to DM us on Whatsapp/Instagram in case of any queries. Happy Clicking!

Nandini: (9896233647)

Jaypee Photo Enthusiasts Guild, the Photography society of JIIT-Noida, bring forth the annual Online photography PIKSEL’20!
Based on three themes the Photography competition aims at bringing the most talented photographers around India, to celebrate their zeal for photography with lots of rewards!!! Themes:
1)Bon Voyage
2)Chiaroscuro
3)Story through my lens

Rules-

1) Only one entry allowed per theme.
2) Photo Manipulation is not allowed. Only basic editing and colour correction allowed.
3)No plagiarism. Please submit your original work.

Methods to submit:
1) Either mail us your entries with all the details including name, college, year etc to jiitjpeg123@gmail.com
2) Or Submit your entries through the Google form- 
https://forms.gle/fpaNmEJBQf1T8EyJ8

Last date to submit entries - 28 February 2020

#photography #enthusiasts #ig_shotz #ig_world #ig_india #ig_delhi #photogram #insta_shot #followforfollow #picoftheday #photographersofindia #global_hotshotz #instagood #vsco #artofvisuals #capture #composition #creative #followme #igers #instafamous #instafollow #natgeoyourshot #mypixeldiary #abstract #stopmotion

Gear up as the Jaypee Photo Enthusiasts Guild(JPEG) brings to you an Online Photography Competition - PIKSEL

The themes are as follows - “Night Lights”,
“Pattern/Pattern Breaking” and
“Photojournalism Through B&W”. Round 1:
~ All the submissions in this event is through social media.
~ Entries will be posted on various pages of the society and will be given great exposure. ~ Judging panel that will decide the best few entries. The criteria will be 60% photography aspects and relation to the
theme and 40% voting.

Round 2:
~ Top 40 best entries will be framed and displayed near Cafeteria on both days of the fest. Well known photography experts are invited as judges to judge the displayed photos. Their decision will be final and irrevocable.

You can submit 1 photograph per theme. Maximum of 3 photographs for 3 different themes.
Don’t shoot what it looks like. Shoot what it feels like before the deadlines approach. The last date for the submissions is 22nd February 2018.

You can mail the entries at jiitjpeg123@gmail.com along with your full name, college name and contact no. The subject of the mail must be the theme name.
You can even fill the form through the QR code and submit your entries.

Form link: 
https://goo.gl/formsORwbZZZL0sRHtDkR2

After a long exasperating week of T-1, JPEG - Jaypee Photo Enthusiasts Guild, the photography hub of our college, proudly announces the second photowalk to of this session giving you the perfect opportunity to rejuvenate and afresh yourself with positive vibes.

Dilli Haat, known for its diverse and wonderful amalgamation of art and culture of different states of India is the perfect blend of a place to learn as well as have fun.

So if you're looking for a weekend getaway that promises loads of fun, travel and learning, we welcome you all to join us in this photowalk.

Venue for meetup- Outside Sarojini Bhawan.
Timing- Saturday, 16 September, 2:00 P.M. Sharp.
(We plan to reach there by 4:00 P.M.)

Are you a picture addict? Love posing and being clicked? Well, no more of getting jealous of your friends' professional photoshoots. Here's your chance to revamp your Instagram walls, pose in all your favourite ways and get clicked by some of the most talented photographers in town!
Jaypee Photo Enthusiasts Guild(JPEG), the film photography hub of JIIT, brings to you an opportunity to be grabbed by both hands. We invite you all for "Walk in photoshoot" wherein you'll be in focus flaunting your poses blended with a tinge of elegance.
So be there dressed in the best way you can.
Date: 2nd August
Time: After the JPEG orientation
Venue: In front of OAT.
Come one, come all. It's going to be fun!

"What is missed by the eyes of the world, is caught by the lens of a photographer." Frame, Focus and Shoot!
Now is the time for all the 1st years to discover and develop the photographer within with the most happening and omnipresent hub of the  college - *JAYPEE PHOTO ENTHUSIASTS GUILD.*
*Come, Connect and Click!*

Say goodbye to bottlenecks and boost performance with technology enabling GPUs to access PCIe-attached memory – where speed meets efficiency! 🚀💾 

New tech from Panmnesia and KAIST allows GPUs to use PCIe-attached memory via a Compute Express Link (CXL) interface. This game-changing technology offers unparalleled speed, efficiency, and scalability, allowing GPUs to access system memory directly with double-digit nanosecond latency.

Whether you're into AI, HPC, games or any high-performance task, CXL GPU Image provides direct storage access, eliminating overhead issues and optimizing performance.

Your leadership, Dr. Verma, is our beacon as we strive to innovate and excel. Here's to a year of growth and success under your invaluable guidance!

Dr. Saxena, your leadership will illuminate our journey as we aim for innovation and excellence. We look forward to a year of remarkable achievements with your support!

As the Core Team 2023-24 of CICE signs off, we reflect on an incredible journey marked by innovation, dedication, and great enthusiasm. Their hard work and visionary leadership have transformed ideas into reality, setting a high standard for excellence and collaboration. Each project and initiative undertaken has not only advanced CICE’s technical prowess but also fostered a vibrant, supportive community. 🚀⭐💡⚡

Though their tenure ends here, the legacy they've built will continue to inspire and drive our tech hub forward. Thank you all for being a part of this extraordinary chapter. We eagerly anticipate your future achievements and look forward to receiving your guidance from time to time. ✨✨

#InnovationJourney #FarewellGratitude #TeamInspiration

"कल, आज, और कल: जब तक संविधान की रक्षा और सम्मान में सहयोग करते हैं, हम गर्व से अपने देश का सम्मान करते हैं।"

This quote is attributed to Pt. Jawaharlal Nehru resonates deeply with the ethos of our nation. It emphasizes the continuity of past, present, and future, underscoring the significance of upholding the principles enshrined in our Constitution. 📖

On this auspicious occasion of Republic Day, CICE celebrates the spirit of freedom and ingenuity. In every circuit designed, in every idea nurtured, we embody the essence of innovation that drives our nation forward. Happy Republic Day!✨

#cicejiit #cice #republicdayindia #india

🔓Unlock the World of Electronics! 
PCB FABRICATION WORKSHOP

📅 29-31st January 2024

The new constitution was drafted by a committee led by Dr. BR Ambedkar after India gained independence from British rule. 

On January 26, 1950, the Indian Constitution went into effect, establishing India as an independent republic. The date of January 26th was chosen because it was on this day in 1930 that the Indian National Congress issued Purna Swaraj, India's declaration of independence from colonial rule.

Let us take a moment to remember the sacrifices of our freedom fighters and the founding fathers of our nation. Let's pledge to uphold the values of democracy, equality and justice that they fought for.

WHAT DO WE DO? Participate in Hackathons😈

We all have attended events organized by GDSC, CICE, Graficas, GameDev, Ribose, but what if I told you that we all hubs decided to take our college events a step further!! 
Yes, you guessed it right, all the above-mentioned hubs have come together to bring to you A JIIT Hackathon: "HackInSummer" which aims to bring together our best coders, developers, designers, innovators, creators, and entrepreneurs of tomorrow. HackInSummer is geared up for those who are passionate about building, designing, and innovating.
It will be 3 days full of fun events, coding, development, jamming, and .....
This event has multiple sub-categories include webdev, blockchain and others. Special rewards have been made for you to win individually. Our speakers are industry experienced professionals coming to talk and guide you. So mark the dates on your calendar for the big event coming starting from April 8. 

Our team looks forward to organise you all and make it memorable for you.
 
https://hackinsummer.live/

Get yourselves ready for HAKUNA MATATA; the most-awaited and enthralling event:
Form a group/individual participation,
choose any activity from the box(the activities consisting of hula hoops, hopping on a single leg, skipping etc)and the respective person performing these random events will be asked questions of which the answer has to be wrong, the person answering the maximum number of wrong answers will be the winner.

Introducing you to our mega event of impressions '20

ROUND-1:(30 mins)
It is a pen and paper quiz which is based on 11th & 12th,1st yr concepts, innovations and general electronics and computer science knowledge. Paper will be the same for all years.
ROUND-2:(50 mins)
20-25 teams for round 2 selected. 
In this round, there are 10 -15 circuits. Each team will give 2 circuits in which they have to identify working one with its application without touching it. 
ROUND-3:(50 mins)
8-12 teams would be finalized for the final round.
In this, there will be domains namely Thermodynamics, Nuclear, Mechanical, Optics, Acoustics, Electric and Magnetic, Network theory, Analog, C, C++, Python which will be written on chits. One member of the team will come to choose the chit. Then a question from the choose chit topic would be asked from each domain there will 10 questions. Negative marking will be there +3 for correct -1 for wrong 0 for not attempted.

Join us and test your knowledge in the most exciting ways and take along with you amazing goodies.
TEAM CAPACITY: 2-3 members in each team

The wait is finally over and here is the list of events that you all have been longing for. We are having 3 events this year, namely, Circuitronix, Ampereio and Roll It Solve It Win It.

Our first event will be  Circuitronix:
A pure technical event, which delves deep into the world of circuits and strands your brain with an Electronics quiz in the first round followed by its hardware implementation and many more interesting challenges. 
Our 2nd event will be Ampereio:
The first round consists of a Crossword puzzle related to the latest technology, second round being Pictionary followed by the final round wherein your circuit designing skills will be tested.

Our 3rd event will be Roll it solve it and win it:
A treasure hunt event with interesting riddles.

So, tighten your seatbelts and get yourselves ready for an exciting event this weekend. Register for these events at our registration desk from 12-2 pm at ABB 1.

On being left with only 9 days for the most-awaited  Electronics event of the year "VIDYUT", we are all ready to set sail into a day filled with technical extravaganza.

Get yourselves into an ever-entertaining and intriguing electronics fest and let your horizons broaden.

Today's day and age have aligned Innovation and Technology together and Vidyut 2019, The Electronics Fest Of JIIT, provides you with just the perfect opportunity to showcase your skills and ideas. We will be presenting before you more than 150 projects, which will exemplify the perfect fusion of core electronics and modern innovation from different fields of technology. So gear up to explore technology like never before and grab this opportunity to have fun, learn and grow.

"I'm an ocean because I'm really deep. If you search deep enough you can find rare exotic treasures"

Confused? Well, you sure must be. Because we are ready to roll out a fun event for the fest 'Roll It Solve It Win It'. Put on your hats and get ready to be a pirate as you embark on a journey to find the hidden treasure in the ever-exciting treasure hunt of this year.

It will be a test of your riddle-solving and observation skills, along with a plethora of enjoyment with your mates. Just search a place that you think matches the clue, find a hidden puzzle there, solve it.
And yes, don't forget to take a selfie at the place so we know you were actually there.

Likewise, solve all the riddles quicker than everyone to win the treasure, that is prize money worth 15k along with exciting goodies. Remember 'richer the treasure, sweeter the pleasure'. For registration:

Have you ever thought about creating your own circuits? 
We are not talking about doing wire connections on the breadboard!
We're talking about printing your own design on the copper board/clad. 
Does that sound interesting to you?
If yes, CICE is proud to organize "PCB Fabrication" workshop in which we will guide you on how to build :

1. ATMEGA-16(AVR) Development board.

2. AVR- ISP programmer.

Here is what you'll take back with yourself from the workshop:

1. An introduction to Eagle software for circuit designing.

2. Printing of the design on the copper clad.

3. Etching out unwanted metal from the copper clad.

4. Mechanical tasks like drilling.

5. An overall run-through of the board.

So gear up for the workshop and register your kit to successfully design your own circuit. 
Get ready to take a dive into the real world of electronics!

Cost for the kit:- ₹ 600/-
Team Size: 2(Maximum)

Registration desk details are as follows:
Date-12-13 September,2018
Time & Venue-
Outside Annapurna:12-2pm 
Outside A2Z: 6-7pm {For JIIT, Sector 128}

Note: All the participants who successfully complete the Fabrication 
process will be awarded certificates.

The Non-Proliferation of Nuclear Weapons is a landmark international treaty signed by nuclear-armed nations including the United States, the United Kingdom, Russia, France and China. The main objective of the treaty is to prevent the spread of nuclear weapons and weapons technology and promote cooperation in the peaceful uses of nuclear energy. The treaty also aims to achieve nuclear disarmament. It is the only binding commitment in a multilateral treaty to the goal of disarmament by the nuclear-weapon States. India is not signatories to the treaty. According to India, the NPT restricts the legal possession of nuclear weapons to those states that tested them before 1967 with properly explaining the grounds on which the distinction is valid. India considers the NPT as a flawed treaty and it does not recognize the need for a universal, non-discriminatory verification and treatment.

The National Technology Day is considered as a symbol of pursuit for technological creativity, scientific inquiry and the conversion of that pursuit in the integration of society and industry. The day is observed to mark the nuclear test that was held in Pokhran on May 11, 1998. 
The first nuclear test Pokhran with a code named as ‘Smiling Buddha’ was carried out in May, 1974. On May 11, 1998, India successfully test-fired nuclear missile Shakti-I at the Pokhran Test Range of Indian Army in Rajasthan in an operation administered by late president and aerospace engineer Dr. APJ Abdul Kalam. 
Overall, five nuclear tests were conducted with the detonation of two fission bombs and one fusion bomb on May 11 and two additional fission bombs on May 13.
 With this, India became the sixth country in the world to join the nuclear powered nation’s club and the first that was not a signatory to the Non-Proliferation of
Nuclear Weapons Treaty (NPT).

We are excited to announce a Slogan & Essay Writing Competition . This is your chance to creatively express your thoughts and contribute to a safe, inclusive campus environment. The topic for this event will be released on the spot.

Guidelines:
 Essay: 500-700 words. 
 Slogan: A catchy phrase (max 15 words).
 Both essay & slogan must be submitted together.
 Language: English or Hindi.
 Judging Criteria: Creativity, relevance, clarity, and originality.
 Prizes: Top 3 winners get certificates and direct entry to round 2 of the Jaypee DebSoc auditions.

Join us and let your words make a difference! Registration link in bio.✨

"🌟 Congratulations to our incredible winners! 🌟 Your words, passion, and dedication shone brightly, leaving us all in awe. But this event was about more than just winning—it was about the courage to speak up, the power of ideas, and the respect we all showed each other. To every participant, thank you for your energy, your perspectives, and your unwavering spirit. You made this event unforgettable. Keep debating, keep growing, and keep making your voices heard! 🗣️💪 

will see you in the orientation...

Prepare for the Battle: The Ultimate Debate Competition is Here! 

The topic is, "A society that has more justice is a society that needs less charity."

"जिस समाज में अधिक न्याय होता है, उस समाज को दान की कम आवश्यकता होती है।"

 Will you emerge as the master of persuasion? Step up, speak out, and let your voice lead the way!

📅 Date: 14/08/24
🕒 Time: 5:00 to 7:00 pm

📝 Guidelines:

- Format: Conventional Debate
- Language: Bilingual
- Each participant gets 3 minutes of speaking time. Keep it concise!
- Participants can choose to speak either for or against the topic.
- After each speech, participating candidates will have the opportunity to cross question. Maximum of two questions will be allowed per speech.

Hey First Years! 🌟

Parola-The literary hub of JIIT along with The Jaypee DebSoc is organising an exclusive and interactive activity just for freshers as part of the Anti-Ragging week. This is your golden opportunity to showcase your oratory skills, sharpen your arguments, and most importantly, have an absolute blast while doing it! 🎉

📅 Date: 14/08/24
🕒 Time: 5:00 to 7:00 pm
📍 Venue: Auditorium

Registration Form:
https://forms.gle/RZr5eDYmg4R71vSM9
(or head over to the link in bio)

📝 Guidelines:

-Format: Conventional Debate
-Language: Bilingual
-Debate topics will be released on August 13th at 5:00 PM sharp on the Instagram pages of Jaypee DebSoc and Parola.
-Each participant gets 1.5 minutes of speaking time. Keep it concise!

Please join the following whatsapp group for updates: https://chat.whatsapp.com/DKMX5ezTQSVJveoR4pehPX

🌟 Final Call for Parola Volunteers! 🌟

We’re wrapping up the forms for Parola: The Literary Society of JIIT. You have 24 hours left to join JIIT’s most prestigious hub!

Be part of our vibrant community, organize the grand Joust Fest, and engage in our MUN society. Don’t miss out on this incredible opportunity!

Apply now and make your mark!

Link in bio.

🌟 We’re Hiring! 🌟

Join Parola: The Literary Society of JIIT as volunteers and be a part of something extraordinary! We’re looking for passionate individuals for the following domains:

Delegate Affairs, Public Relations, Marketing, Management, Digital Design, Creative, and Cinematics.

Break away from the cage of typical 9–5 classes and immerse yourself in the vibrant world of Parola! Be part of organizing our prestigious Joust Fest and engaging MUN conferences. Experience the thrill of contributing to the most reputed and renowned hub of our college.

Unleash your potential, showcase your skills, and make a mark with Parola. Join us and be the driving force behind unforgettable events and experiences!

Link in bio, apply before 8th August.

🌟 We’re Hiring! 🌟

Join Parola: The Literary Society of JIIT to organize The JOUST and other great events. Experience the legacy of organizing one of the grand events of Delhi NCR!

Link in bio, apply by 8th August.

In the milieu of precision and dedication, Yashovardhan, our Management Head at Parola, stands out! 🌟

"Leadership is not about being in charge. It’s about taking care of those in your charge." This quote perfectly captures Yashovardhan's approach. His management expertise ensures that every project runs seamlessly. His leadership and organizational skills keep our team on track and focused. A fan of Harry Potter, Hangover, and Gangs of Wasseypur, he brings a unique blend of creativity and discipline to his role.

We’re so excited to have him steering our management team!

In the expanse of unyielding passion and boundless dedication, Kunal, our Director of Parola, reigns supreme! 🌟

"Passion is the spark that ignites excellence and transforms work into art." 🎶🎬 This quote perfectly reflects Kunal’s fervor for his role. "Kunal, our resident Game of Thrones expert, loves quoting Jon Snow and has an eclectic music taste that spans from The Weeknd to Pankaj Udhas.". 🎤🎧

Kunal’s unwavering commitment and boundless enthusiasm are further amplified by his extensive experience in debating and MUN conferences accompanied by profound love for the English language. These experiences have sharpened his leadership and strategic skills, allowing him to guide and inspire with exceptional insight and effectiveness.
Get ready to be inspired by Kunal's dynamic leadership and unwavering passion!

Within the scope of constant challenges and triumphs, Hardik, our Management Head, shines brightly. 🌟

"In the dance of challenges and triumphs, balance is the rhythm that turns effort into excellence." 🎩✨ This quote perfectly captures Hardik, who masterfully juggles challenges with ease and makes every problem seem manageable. His unwavering support and reliability stand out, while his effortless charm and ability to balance work and fun reveal his passion and dedication.

Prepare for a blend of fun, support, and seamless management as Hardik leads the way with his unique blend of brilliance and heart! 🌟🔧

In the spectrum of digital dynamism and boundless creativity, Prachi, our Digital Head at Parola, shines brightly! 🌟

In the expanse of storytelling and relentless energy, Tanmay Singh, our Digital Head at Parola, stands out for his exceptional digital innovation and creativity!✨

“Being in command is not what leadership is about. It’s about looking out for people under your supervision.” Tanmay’s methodology is aptly encapsulated in this phrase. “A mentor is someone who allows you to see the hope inside yourself.” With this sentiment in mind, we are delighted to introduce Dr. Yogita Naruka as our esteemed Faculty Coordinator for the Session 2024-25!

“Goodbyes aren’t forever. They simply mean ‘until we meet again📝.’”

As the tenure for the session 2023-24 comes to a close, we pass the legacy of our hub to new leaders. It’s a bittersweet moment as we say farewell to our senior advisors, Gautam sir, Vanshaj sir , Parth sir, Prarit sir and Rika ma’am. It all began when you took on the task of reviving our college’s literary fest, The JOUST , after a three-year hiatus . Little did we know, this would lead to the creation of lasting friendships and cherished memories ❤️.

From mentors to friends, from being a helping hand to a shoulder to lean on, you became our safe haven, a beacon of hope when things got tough. You were visionary leaders, inspiring us with your dedication and passion. The time spent with you will be remembered as some of our sweetest college experiences. You encouraged us to challenge our limits, step out of our comfort zones, and grow into confident individuals.

As your college journey ends, we bid you a heartfelt goodbye with deep gratitude . May you shine and inspire wherever you go, achieving everything you desire✨.

From ,
Team Parola

We are pleased to introduce the United Nations Human Rights Council (UNHRC) 🌏 Background Guide, a comprehensive and invaluable resource designed to empower our esteemed members. 

✨This guide offers a detailed introduction to the committee, the chosen topic, a set of pertinent questions, and a range of references meticulously curated by our executive board. It equips our delegates with the essential knowledge and insights they need as they approach the upcoming committee sessions.

With the paramount agenda of safeguarding the rights of Uyghur Muslims in China, our delegates are poised with a wealth of compelling information, ensuring their ability to articulate their positions and advocate for human rights with unparalleled eloquence and effectiveness.

Join us for the prestigious Model United Nations (MUN) at JOUST'23 and seize the opportunity to sharpen your diplomatic skills with the most prominent Executive Board members from the circuit, expand your global perspective, and make lasting connections! 🪄📚

#JOUST23 #LiteraryFestival #UnleashYourPotential #TheJoust2023 #joustjiit #joust2023 #joust #delhi #literaryfiction #delhincrcolleges #mun #modelunitednation #JOUSTLiteraryFest #DebateForChange  #YouthEmpowerment #Joust2023 #LiteraryFest #jiit

"The environment is where we all meet; where we all have a mutual interest; it is the one thing all of us share." - Lady Bird Johnson🌿🌎

Presenting to you the Executive Board of UNEP🎖️

🌟Introducing Mr Vinayak, our Chairperson who hails from the vibrant city of Faridabad in Haryana and is a dedicated student currently pursuing a degree in Economics at Delhi University. His academic journey is fueled by a profound interest in both national and international politics, coupled with a deep passion for global economic affairs. In the realm of Model United Nations (MUN), Vinayak has earned recognition and respect for his exemplary leadership. He has chaired in esteemed institutions such as Kalinga Institute of Industrial Technology (KIIT), Jesus and Mary College, Jamia Millia Islamia, and several more.

🌟Introducing Ms Arshia , our Vice-Chairperson. Since 2019, she has actively participated in more than 90 Model United Nations (MUN) conferences, youth summits, discussion panels and forums  showcasing her fervor for diplomacy and negotiation.
She stands as a dedicated orator, earning accolades not only from MUNs but also from debates, turncoats, and various other competitions on both national and international stages. Her commitment to social responsibility is exemplified by her collaboration with numerous humanitarian organizations, including Goong NGO and The Menaka Gandhi Organisation for Animal Welfare. She has previously worked as an intern at UNGC, UNGYS, Humans for Humankind and Sexceed International. Arshia is also a YLAC Harvard scholar and had received acceptance as a Yale young global scholar.

🌍 "Human rights are the foundation of a just world." 🌍
Introducing our Executive Board of UNHRC 🌟
🌟 Vimal Mishra, our President, is an ambitious visionary. With a profound passion for debates, and storytelling, and an unwavering affinity for the beauty of the English language, he exemplifies a voracious orator with keen insights into national and international agendas. Vimal's seven-year journey through diverse Indian societies spanning debates, MUNs, writing, poetry, and storytelling showcases his unwavering dedication to diplomacy and journalism. His fervour for education and dreams of establishing schools, coupled with an insatiable curiosity, underlines his unparalleled qualifications and commitment. 📚✨

🚀 Hiten Chadha, our Vice President, is an embodiment of MUN excellence. His extensive experience as Chairperson and Co-Chair in prominent MUNs and an exceptional record of Best Delegate awards illustrates his leadership in the world of diplomacy. He possesses unparalleled expertise in steering committees to success. 🗳️With a commendable history of excelling as a delegate, Hiten is well-equipped to steer the UNHRC Committee towards success, fueled by his dedication and remarkable achievements in the MUN arena.🏆

🌟 Praseem Jaiswal, our co-vice President, possesses a wealth of knowledge and is an outstanding diplomat. From Chairing DISEC to UNHCR, UNHRC, and AIPPM and participating over 40 MUNs and Counting, Mr. Jaiswal's experience goes beyond traditional MUNs, excellence extending to Hindi parliamentary debates as well, demonstrating his linguistic prowess and his ability to effectively engage in political discussions. 
In addition to this, Mr. Jaiswal has taken on key leadership roles as Deputy Chairperson of the Rajya Sabha at the Youth Cynosure conference and have received numerous accolades at the Delhi MUN , Zakir Hussain MUN and many more.

Their inquisitive nature and unwavering commitment to human rights make them the perfect leader for the UNHRC. 🤝 🌍

 #UNHRCPresident #MUNLeader #ChampionOfHumanRights

"Politics is the art of the possible, and in AIPPM, we explore the possibilities of a better world through diplomacy and debate."🏛️
As we dive into the realm of Indian politics and policy-making we present the exceptional minds steering the helm of JOUST's AIPPM Committee. 

🌟 Introducing the remarkable Mr Abhinav Narayan, our AIPPM Moderator, a practising attorney with a presence in both Patna and Delhi. His academic background includes an LL.M. degree from Chanakya National Law University, Patna, and a law degree from Amity University, Noida. He has had the privilege of working alongside prominent figures such as the former External Affairs and Law Minister of India, Mr. Salman Khurshid, and Rajya Sabha Member of Parliament, Dr. Subramanian Swamy. His extensive experience in political engagement extends to chairing over 100 Youth Parliaments across India. He was Felicitated with the Society Development Award 2018 by Anand NGO in Delhi and the Bharat Leadership Award 2018 By the International Institutional Organization in Patna.

🌟 Introducing the remarkable Miss Jiny Jawa, our AIPPM Deputy Moderator. With a passion for the spoken word, she's achieved milestones that are nothing short of awe-inspiring. Serving on the Executive Board of many prestigious MUNs. Her accolades speak volumes: "Best Delegate" at the Birla Institute of Engineering and Technology, Pilani MUN, and "High Commendation" at BITS MUN. Her talent and creativity continue to blossom, weaving stories and verses that resonate with hearts and minds alike. 📖🌼

🌟 Introducing Mr. Sankalp Bharadwaj a graduate holding a Bachelor of Technology degree and a literary enthusiast, a dedicated debater and a masterful speaker as our Deputy Moderator. With over 50+ MUNs he has been an exceptional debater with several Best Delegate, High commendation, and Special Mention awards. As we dive headfirst into the most anticipated events of Impression'23, Parola, the literary hub of JIIT presents to you- Words Brawl! 

The event will be conducted as follows:-

Step 1-The contestant will be required to pick up a chit that shall enlist to them the role of a famous personality.

Step 2- The contestant shall pick up another chit that shall enlist to them a topic/situation in which the character assigned to them has to be portrayed.
Henceforth, the contest begins as each individual brings forward the best of their eloquence and sharp-witedness.

Let the gaze of the audience fan the inward fires of oratory in you as you indulge in all the tricks and delusions of this master skill!

Date: 19 March, 2023
Time: 10:00am
Venue: LT5

The rules and regulations for the content writing competition are as follows:
1) Every entry for this competition should comprise of a maximum of 30 words.
2) The entries will be taken through google Form (link is in the bio).
3) The Entries could be either in English or Hindi.
4) Any sort of plagiarism will not be tolerated, this would lead to immediate disqualification.
5) The judgment would be based on the number of  likes, comments, and shares every post has
  Each Like - 2 points
  Each Comment - 5 points
  Each Share - 8 points 
6) The deadline for the entries would be Sept 5th,2022 till 11:59PM and the like comments and shares would be counted till September 7th,2022.
 NOTE: The Likes , Comments and Shares will be considered only if the Insta Page of PAROLA - parola.literaryhub is followed by that respective ID.

Hello fellow human, 

Do you consider yourself to be articulate or rather eloquent in nature? If yes, then we have good news coming your way! 

Parola × Debsoc presents you *Kakori Tales*

An Essay Writing Competition for all our ambitious writers! 

Theme: The Kakori Conspiracy- 
In a well-planned operation, a band of revolutionary activists robbed a train passing through the town of Kakori. 
This major event took place on August 9, 1925 and not so many years later, we are here to take you back in time. 

All participants would be given the topic on the spot and the Rules of Procedure for the event would be informed on our Instagram Page!

*Date: August 10, 2022*
*Timings: 5PM Onwards*
*Venue: LT-4*
*Prize Pool- ₹2250*

Literature is the mirror of evolution of a society’s cultures and beliefs. For the breadth of knowledge it gives, the moral values it carries and the enjoyment it provides, literature is important.

Laura Ingalls Wilder’s works are considered to have set a benchmark in children’s literature that has persisted timelessly. She’s known for the unique way through which she inspired young minds with essential lessons of life.

Remembering her remarkable contribution to literature, The Joust presents, ‘Humans of Literature’ to all the literary enthusiasts.

When exploring fictional, historical, or far off worlds that exist in the literature, the ability to empathize or understand even a fraction of what the characters go through pulls us closer together as humans. Literature grants an equal playing field and allows people to project themselves into worlds they may never experience in real life, but at least they can know their feelings and experiences are not singular.

Helen Keller is one of the most memorable women in history. Despite being blind as well as deaf, she learned to communicate and lived a life devoted to helping others.

The Joust presents 'Humans Of Literature.' Stay tuned for more updates!

Come and get mesmerized by rhythmic verses that will leave you spellbound. The Joust presents to you 'Slammed!!!’ -  A Poetry Competition, so get ready to present your poetry at one of the biggest literary events in the Delhi NCR.

Stay tuned as we reveal more events.

Do you want to showcase your skills in literature and photography and are searching for a good platform for the same?
If so, then your wait is over.

We welcome you to “The Press”, the photography and journalism event of the Joust. Come, be a part of one of the biggest literary festivals of Delhi NCR organised by Parola - The Literary Hub of JIIT. Opportunity knocks on your door only once so don’t let this one get away.

"War does not determine who is right - only who is left." -Bertrand Russell.

In a war, the heroes always outnumber the soldiers ten to one and it's your time to bring out the heroes within yourself. A pen is mightier than the sword, but voice is still mightier than the script. Let your profound voices be raised against the inescapable silence at hand as we lift the curtains from the face of "World War Continuous Crisis" Committee.

Stay tuned as we reveal more opportunities.

The deteriorating state of the environment over the past few decades has taken the form of a dangerous demon looming over the lives of all people.

We, at the Joust 2018 have simulated the perfect committee to combat these problems - United Nations Environment Programme, to plan and promote the implementation of environment-friendly practices and embrace the green revolution. 
Stay tuned as we release more events!

"In politics, nothing happens by accident. If it happens, you can bet it was planned that way." - Franklin D Roosevelt

Gear up for an intriguing experience of dialectic disputation at one of the best literary extravaganzas of Delhi NCR. The Joust 2018 proudly presents its first committee- All India Political Parties Meet, where people will come together to plan and debate future policies.

Stay tuned as we reveal more events.

“It’s not hard to make decisions once you know what your values are." - Roy E. Disney

We, at The Joust bring to you an amazing opportunity to embrace your professional and networking skills. If you are hard working, enthusiastic and motivated enough towards your career, then come and be a part of one of the biggest literary festivals of Delhi NCR. Join the Campus Ambassador program and share your energy and zeal with us.
The application deadline for campus ambassador is July 26, 2018.

Application link in bio.

Please read the form description for more details.

The literary extravaganza, The Joust 2018 is finally back in its 4th edition. Save the dates, 22-23 September and prepare yourself for the war of words.

Stay tuned!
#thejoust18

“The ladder of success is best-climbed by stepping on the rungs of opportunity.” – Ayn Rand

The Joust 2018 presents you with the golden opportunity to be a part of its organising committee. Every second year who has ever wished to be a part of a grand scale event can showcase their skills and talent and enhance their skills through the experience gained. So grab this chance before it slips away and apply for the OC, the link for which you’ll find in bio.

Please note that only those in their third semester are eligible to apply. Applications will be closed by 18 July, 12 Noon.

The success of an event hinges on the support it garners from masses and organisers alike, and The Joust 2018 couldn’t have asked for better supporters than our esteemed Faculty Co-ordinators, Dr. Santosh Dev and Mrs. Puneet Pannu.
Providing a strong foundation to the team, they have been our guide and a constant source of encouragement.

Since its inception, they have always lent unparalleled support to the Joust as mentors to the organising committee.

The clash of opinions, heated arguments as well as exquisite poetry, are going to unravel soon. After an unprecedented success in the past few years, the literary fest of JIIT, The Joust, is finally back in its 4th edition. The stage is set, so prepare yourself as the stakes are going to be higher and the battle will be fiercer than ever.
Joust is back!
#joust18

"Every experience is a once in a lifetime experience, because no matter how hard we try, nothing’s ever exactly the same the way it was the first time."
– Jolene Perry

First experiences sure are scary and when it comes to The Joust, that challenge was faced by our seniors as well. Follow them along as they recount their time at The Joust and give a few words of advice to the first timers. 
Make sure to pay attention, or you might miss something that could come in handy later.

"मेरा धर्म सत्य और अहिंसा पर आधारित है, सत्य मेरा भगवान है, अहिंसा उसे पाने का साधन।" The second of October serves as an opportunity to reflect on the teachings of Mahatma Gandhi. We at Parola hope that the principles of non-violence that he stood for remain forever enshrined in the minds of people all over the globe.

On the 147th birth anniversary of Mahatma Gandhi, we all thank this great saint for securing freedom for our country and stand committed for a peaceful and a non-violent future.

With only about a week to go for the big weekend, the team is bustling with excitement in preparation for the event where words envisage wisdom! 
#thejoust17

Education is the most powerful weapon which you can use to change the world.

NIIT is a leading Skills and Talent Development Corporation that is building a manpower pool for global industry requirements. The company, which was set up in 1981 to help the nascent IT industry overcome its human resource challenges, today ranks among the world’s leading training companies owing to its vast, yet the comprehensive array of talent development programs. With a footprint across 40 nations, NIIT offers training and development solutions to Individuals, Enterprises and Institutions and continues to influence the leaders and corporations worldwide, ushering in an era of great change owing to its immense success. 
We are proud to have a partner in you, NIIT.

For more details visit thejoust17.com

"Twice and thrice over, as they say, good is it to repeat and review what is good." - Plato

So we here review, revise and render it again. The Joust'17 brings you this video to dive into its history and be a part of its heritage.

So swim deep and earn the pearls of experience, knowledge and beauty of speech by witnessing the participants of Joust'16 describing their most memorable moments of the event. 
We say what we do!
Stay tuned.

Nothing is truly great in its lifetime. The test of greatness is the page of history. 
To attest to the greatness of The Joust, today we reopen the chapter that was closed last year and revisit the past moments of glory. A short series of reviews presented by the last year participants will paint a fair picture of this phenomenal event.

For details go to thejoust17.com

We are ready! Are you?

#thejoust17

Guard well your thoughts when alone and your words when accompanied.

With the stage set and just a few weeks to go for the event, we heat up the proceedings as we release the tagline for the 3rd edition of the Joust.

We present to you, The Joust'17 - WHERE WORDS ENVISAGE WISDOM!

For more details visit www.thejoust17.com

"A cashless economy is secure, it is clean. You have a leadership role to play in taking India towards an increasingly digital economy." - Narendra Modi

With only three weeks remaining, the excitement and the enthusiasm are at their apex. Most exciting two days in the literary world are round the corner. 
The Joust'17 is proud to present Instamojo as their Online Payment Partner. 
For more details visit thejoust17.com

Path Infotech Ltd. offers a wide spectrum of solutions and services to enable efficiency, accuracy, and scalability of business functions of their customers spanning from Manufacturing to Finance to Distribution to HR to CRM. Their service practice covers Mobility, Analytics, Cloud, Enterprise Technology, Managed Services, and System Integration.

Their vision is to be leading providers of integrated business solutions - helping organizations across the globe to achieve higher and higher levels of customer satisfaction.

We at the Joust'17 are proud to have Path Infotech Ltd. as our Education partner.

For more details visit thejoust17.com

"Social media is reducing social barriers. It connects people on the strength of human values, not identities." - Narendra Modi
.
DUKhabar.com is a place made by the people of Delhi University. It strives to provide the latest and most accurate information available anywhere about their very own University. Whether it is about events in colleges and beyond or the latest news.They provide students from all sorts of backgrounds, a platform, to present their views on whatever they may see fit for.

It's our pleasure to have DU Khabar as our media partner.

For more details visit thejoust17.com

Social media is the ultimate equalizer. It gives a voice and a platform to anyone willing to engage." - Amy Jo Martin

The Joust'17, literary festival of JIIT is bringing you the official Blogger Outreach Partner of our event, Blogadda.

Blodadda has grown to become the largest community of bloggers in India. It is a platform for bloggers to connect with each other, showcase their blogs and participate in interesting activities. Blogadda has given various avenues to introduce their blogs to a large audience and interact with their readers. 
With this, we are glad to be associated with the Blogadda for our event.

For more details visit thejoust17.com

DU Beat is an independent student run newspaper based in Delhi University. One of the largest campus publications in India, they are strong believers of Freedom of Expression. 
Follow them at www.dubeat.com​ for news, analysis and opinion from Delhi University and much more for the student community!

We are proud to announce DU Beat as our media partner.

For more details visit thejoust17.com

DU Updates is a platform to share all the happenings around Delhi. DU Updates intends to fetch all the news and information of events, fests, competitions, different opportunities around Delhi's different college campuses. They keep you engaged and entertain you with different trending topics.

DU Updates was started with a motive to help the new coming buds on the campus who have no idea what to do and how to do. Learning, Knowing and Sharing is their method to work. 
We are proud to announce DU Updates as our media partner.

For more details visit thejoust17.com

"Media that impacts people must be a reflection of reality." The Citizen is India’s first independent online daily offering in-depth news analysis from key experts. They offer a combination of news and views, with behind-the-news factual pieces on the headlines being accompanied by exclusive stories, features and opinion pieces. The Citizen (www.thecitizen.in) is a voice of the citizens and does not compromise.

We at The Joust'17 feel contented to have The Citizen as our media partner.

For more details visit thejoust17.com

University Express (popularly known as UE) is a global media platform that not only delivers university news but also acts as a barometer to the rapidly changing society through the eyes of today’s generation, via its insightful and esteemed columns. Currently, it is one of the most widespread networks to reach out to college going students across India.

We are proud to announce University Express as our media partner.

For more details visit thejoust17.com

We would like to thank DU Express for being our Media Partners for The Joust - Literary Fest of JIIT.

DU Express is an initiative to provide reliable information to students. Along with Campus news, the online platform also covers social, economic and political issues that concern an average college student.From book reviews to movie reviews; from awareness about start-ups to established businesses and from places to grab a bite to hang out joints, you’ll find everything here.

For more details visit thejoust17.com

As a general rule, the most successful person is the one who has the best information.

Social Tahelka is an e-magazine that shares a variety of content from current affairs to lifestyle, industry news to interviews, sports to astrology, travel to health and startup stories to viral videos. They bring to you the best information there is to ensure your success.

The Joust’17 is delighted to have a media partner in Social Tahelka.

For more details visit thejoust17.com

“Life should be a continuous celebration, a festival of lights the whole year round. Only then can you grow up, can you blossom.” Festpav.com is a website that keeps you constantly updated with the various kinds of fests and events that can bring colour to your life. It covers different types of events all over India and provides you with extensive information regarding them.

We are glad to have a partner in Festpav.

For more details visit thejoust17.com

"Accurate information is a key part of motivation." CollegeDesk is a students’ media organization that helps students to sail through the information needs that a college goer must be aware of. It provides information about deadlines, date-sheets and important events as well as subject notes and previous year exam papers. It also organizes trips and keeps students updated on various things.

The Joust’17 is proud to be associated with College Desk. 
For more details visit thejoust17.com
