The Joust is back,
Advanced and Rejuvenated!
With an intellectual setting and fanatical aura surrounding it.
Brace yourselves for a trip down the verbal war lane! 
To all of you out there who are eagerly waiting to flaunt their verbal skills and the sharpness of their your mind, mark your calendar, note the time and pledge to be there for the unveiling of the biggest debating and poetry extravaganza in Delhi-NCR!

Parola - The Literary Hub of JIIT presents to you a short teaser to give you a glimpse of all the magic you will witness.

Link for the application forms in bio! 
#TheJoust17

"Things may come to those who wait, but only the things left by those who hustle."
-Abraham Lincoln

So, the time to hustle has come for those who have a desire to achieve big things through debating. The Joust'17 brings you the White House Situation Room with the agenda being classified.

So it's your time to put your feet in the right place and make right decisions because this room has given America many glorious moments by making right decisions. Come prepared and unfold all your skills at The Joust 2017!

Application link in bio! 
#TheJoust'17

"Time is not measured by the passing of years but by what one does, what one feels and what one achieves" -Jawaharlal Nehru

What we develop here is what we portray beyond this time. So inherit the colors of critical analysis, debate and expression of speech through this platform.

Thus, we unveil the agenda of the much awaited committee, Lok Sabha - 'Strengthening the Indian foreign policy with regards to changing geopolitical situation.' So come and paint the canvas of future India with your better understanding of its foreign policies and creativity to reclaim them.

Application form linked in bio!

‘The 21st century is the century of knowledge. Knowledge, science and education will have the power and strength to embrace the entire universe.’ - Narendra Modi

The Joust brings to you UP Stakeholder’s meet, a simulation that’ll keep your brains churning and make you think beyond the convention. 
We present you with the agenda for the stimulating committee, ‘reviewing three years of Modi government’.
So put your thinking caps on and prepare to engage in an informative and innovative session that reviews the impact of ground breaking reforms like demonetization and GST on various businesses and like.

Application linked in bio!

“Our nation is like a tree of which the original trunk is swarajya and the branches are swadeshi and boycott.” — Bal Gandhar Tilak.

Lets take a moment in salutation of the countless sacrifices made by our great freedom fighters. Let us continue to be inspired by their selfless spirit and endeaveour to keep the honor for our motherland above everything else! 
Ask not what your country can do for you. Ask what you can do for your country.
The Team of The Joust'17 wishes you all a very Happy Independence Day!

"No matter how old you are now. You are never too young or too old for success or going after what you want." Applications for most exciting two days of debating are now going live! Seize the date because it's now or never. So we are pleased to present you the Delegate and IP application form for the Joust 2017.

Get ready for some action, enthusiasm and debating.

Application form linked in bio!

How wonderful the day becomes when the scorching sun rays blend with the lonely clouds to reveal the wonderful seven colours of the rainbow. How about getting a chance to explore our hidden talents in the rush of our hectic schedules. Don’t you find it parallel?

A good picture always keeps a moment from running away. Let’s change our focus to capture something entertaining. Well here comes the day to invite you young hearts to set your hands on the camera lens and let the flashlight lighten your hidden potential.

We welcome you to Reseau, the photography event of Joust.

#TheJoust17

Ever been curious about the United States network of key national security operations and intelligence centres?

Come allay your curiosity by gaining a close insight to the above in the third edition of The Joust 2017.

A  two-day event where you get to be a part of the situation room thereby having a gateway to understanding of National Security Council and White House functions and how intelligence information is provided to key decision makers including the President.

Stay tuned as the delegate applications go live soon.

#TheJoust17

Poetry is not a turning loose of emotion, but an escape from emotion. It is not the expression of personality, but an escape from personality. Poetry is the spontaneous overflow of powerful feelings. It takes its origin from emotion recollected in tranquillity.

We at The Joust 2017 bring to you all a slam poetry event where you get a chance to incarnate your words and melt them down to passive realities.

Stay tuned as more surprises await you all.

"Words have power and when you speak you give them life." The spoken word has immeasurable power especially in today's age of social media. We at The Joust are here with a conventional-style debate where you can present your eloquence and argumentation skills to the highest level.

We offer you a chance to mark your presence in the debating world, with full confidence and pride. We present to you, The Verbal Crusade.

Applications to be live soon!

"Knowledge is gained by learning, trust by doubt and skills by practice." - Thomas S. Szasz

It is a tremendous power to influence others, the skills of an ultimate leadership. The Joust - Literary Festival of JIIT gives you the chance to nurture this art within you. We bring to you a stupendous one more two-day Indian Committee that will bring out an inconceivable leader in you. So don't miss this decisive opportunity.

Come, practice and edify your skills and personality.

Stay tuned as we unravel more events.

"A leader is one who knows the way, goes the way and shows the way." - John C. Maxwell

Do you have a leader within wanting to express itself? Are you unsure of the ‘way’ you must go through to become one? Well, fear not!

Lok Sabha, the bilingual committee, gives you the opportunity to give voice to reasonable arguments, debate on social issues and help you find your way as a leader in making. So, hurry up and come with your pen and paper prepared and get ready to nurture the budding orator within yourself. After all, only a good orator with the skills to inspire others through words can make for a good leader.

Stay tuned as we unravel more events tomorrow!

“The clash of ideas is not weakness. Truth reaches its place when tussling with an error.” -  Richard Henry Pratt

The Joust in its 3rd edition this year has proved its mettle for the past two years by inculcating the voice of reason and leaving room for heated arguments to arrive at a conclusion, stimulating the minds and stirring the debater within them. And here it is again, the Literary Festival of JIIT, bigger and better than ever rekindling the lost spirit of Jaypee Youth Parliament.

With a total of seven events this time, the Joust is all set to sweep you along into the world of literature, poetry and deliberation. Stay tuned for the rest of the announcements to know more about the events that’ll be happening.
#TheJoust17

"For good ideas and true innovations, you need human interaction, conflict, argument, debate." - Margaret Heffernan

And our history testified it every time. The greatest leaders of our history had always been the greatest debaters. And leaders are not born, they are made by honing their skills.

The Joust 2017 brings you this opportunity. Come and explore the concealed leader in you. Give him the voice and be the change you want to cherish. The Joust - Literary Festival of JIIT gives you this chance on the 7th and 8th of October 2017.

Don't miss it, let your words be the mightiest. Stay tuned!
#TheJoust17

Welcome to Micromania, an exciting online event dedicated to the fascinating world of microcontrollers!

Day 1: Microcontroller Workshop👩🏻‍🏫 ( 16 July 2024)

Dive into the world of microcontrollers whether you’re a beginner or have some experience, we will guide you through the basics and beyond, ensuring you grasp the essentials in an exciting and interactive way.

📍Venue : Google meet link will be shared with you a day before.
⏰ Workshop Timing : 12:00 pm

Day 2: Interactive Quiz🚀 ( 17 July 2024)

Test your newfound knowledge with our amazing and interactive quiz! Compete with fellow participants, challenge your understanding, and win exciting prizes. This fun-filled session will reinforce what you’ve learned and provide a thrilling experience.
 
Quiz Rules :

1) Group-wise Participation:
- Participants will be organized  into groups based on registration details
- Each group will be called to participate in the quiz sessions sequentially. 

2)  Scheduled Sessions: 
- Groups will receive information via WhatsApp, before hand,  regarding their scheduled quiz session time.
- Participants must join the designated Google Meet link at their assigned time.

3)  Individual Assessment: 
- During the session, each participant will be individually assessed.
- Participants will be asked general and interesting questions related to Robotics.

4) Assessment Criteria:
- Answers will be evaluated based on correctness, clarity, and understanding of the topic.
- Judges will assess participants’ responses during the face-to-face Google Meet session.
- No need to worry, it will be fun and interactive for every participant :) 

5) Final Round Selection:
- Top participants from each group will proceed to a final round based on their performance.
- The final round will be very interesting.

6) Winner Declaration: 
- The overall winner will be decided based on performance throughout all rounds.
- Results and awards will be announced at the conclusion of the workshop
. 
Link : https://forms.gle/4tR94hpFvET8YZBt5

μCR presents: Hand Gesture Robot Workshop
Are you ready to embark on a journey of personal and professional growth?
We are thrilled to announce the upcoming workshop registration at the μCR Hub, and we can't wait for you to be a part of it! 🌟

In an era where continuous learning and skill development are essential, the μCR Hub is your gateway to unlocking your full potential. Our workshops are designed to inspire, empower, and equip you with the knowledge and tools you need to excel in your endeavors.

Join us as we bring together a community of individuals who share your passion for lifelong learning. These workshops are not just about acquiring new skills; they're about fostering connections, igniting your curiosity, and expanding your horizons.

Unlock the door to the universe of μCR hub and the mesmerizing world of gesture-controlled bots.
Learn to build and program a hand gesture-controlled robot. Get hands-on experience with cutting-edge robotics technology. Interact with experienced robotics professionals.

𝐊𝐞𝐲𝐞𝐧𝐜𝐞 𝐈𝐧𝐝𝐢𝐚 has procured not only an excellent technical engineer who possesses outstanding skills and deep knowledge but also an employee with an inspirational character and great charisma.

Shubham sir might be leaving us to move forward on his own journey but he has left behind a legacy which will be remembered for ages to come. His contributions to our hub and the entire college are nothing short of a wonder.

We wish him nothing but well wishes of fortune and success for him as Shubham sir goes ahead to work at Keyence.

Regards
Team µcr

Team Mucr attended the Tech fest organized by #IITKanpur in March 2023.

The entire journey starting from the initial discussions, to building our bots and finally participating in combats and races was a bliss; something we will cherish through out our lives.

We had a blast learning, making mistakes, and bonding with each other while discovering new parts of ourselves.

As I reflect on the experience, I realize it was never about winning.

(We literally bursted 'several' Arduino UNO's, I-6 recievers and what not while making our bots.)
.
 
.
.
.

The Microcontroller Based Systems and Robotics Hub presents 𝐁𝐨𝐛-𝐭𝐡𝐞-𝐁𝐮𝐢𝐥𝐝𝐞𝐫🤖 event during 𝐈𝐦𝐩𝐫𝐞𝐬𝐬𝐢𝐨𝐧𝐬'𝟐𝟑.💥

Date: 18th March 2023
Time: 11am-5 pm
Venue: Atrium

Team μcr

Learning becomes wisdom only after it has been put to practical use. Each one of us is made of experiences. Technophillia'22 calls out all quick-witted problem-solvers out there to participate in "The Mind Flayer", the problem-solving round.

The contestants will have to brainstorm, analyze and solve some stimulating Arduino based problems. osdcjiit.caption:
Introducing 0xMadhav, our senior advisor, a man whose intimidating appearance belies his true nature. With a gaze that could pierce steel and a demeanour as gruff as sandpaper, he cuts an imposing figure. But those who know him well understand that beneath that tough exterior beats a kitten heart.

This enigmatic and sophisticated figure is a genius in his own right, a master of technology who can hack into the most secure systems with ease, he is truly the OSDDos.

But for all his technical prowess, it is his kindness and helpfulness that truly sets him apart. He may look like a man who has seen the darker side of life, but in reality, you'll find that he is as soft and cuddly as a bed of flowers. He may look intimidating, but trust us he's not (just don't tell him we said that - he has a reputation to maintain, after all).

@madhavmehndiratta

poster design creds: @lexoskeletons

This guy knows about every piece of media under the sun. You've watched it? he's already written three theses and one dissertation on it. He knows all, sees all and hears all. If you fall asleep at night hearing about dune and spiderverse, it's probably because he invented a machine that transports it to your sleeping minds like some kind of twisted sandman. 

Whenever he walks into a room, daft punk plays on full volume despite the absence of speakers. He's the go- to guy if you ever need help with python or open sorcery or anything at all because he won't let you down.
Introducing the coolest of us all, OSDChad - exitflynn.

poster design creds: @lexoskeletons

Introducing the community's senior advisor shivang 0_0, a man so diligent he makes even the most hardworking ants look like slackers. If you've ever seen him, chances are you've seen him smiling with his infectious candy sweet smile. Most of the team's work is done on time due to his efforts. 

He's like a cross between Yoda and Mary Poppins, dispensing wisdom and kindness in equal measure.  A powerhouse of management, optimism and not getting references, he is truly the OSDad. So if you're ever in need of some expert advice or just a good laugh, be sure to seek out our senior advisor- shivang0_0.

@shivang.sharma_

poster design creds: @lexoskeletons

Introducing Som, our technical coordinator. This guy is the team's monke man and makes legendary speeches.
He is a football fan and loves music. Som cooks up dope tunes which delight his fans, famously known as kukis. 

If you're lucky, you might catch one of his super amazing beatboxing performances and even get his special secret chai recipe (if you ask nicely). Master of all traits, Som can juggle a thousand tasks all at once without ever letting the crew down.

@sohamkukreti

poster design creds: @lexoskeletons

Introducing Rathi, our student coordinator who is a big finance and tech nerd. Legend goes that Rathi once wrote a program that could predict the stock market with 100% accuracy. Of course, he had to destroy it to prevent it from falling into the wrong hands, but the legend lives on.

He loves to go back to his wizard hut to cook stuff up with Elixir and tinker around with python. And whatever you do, don't challenge him to a Codeforces joust. Rathi's the chillest dude on the team (and he knows it).

@yryuvraj

poster design creds: @lexoskeletons

OSDC invites you all to CODEJAM-V4 which is a week-long music-themed hackathon "Give Life Back to Music". 🎹🎶✨

Spend more hours on Spotify or YT music than interacting with your family? Can't survive without a pair of headphones? Can't study without lo-fi music? I think we have an event that's just for you. A five day online music themed hackathon combining your love of coding and music. 👨‍💻👩‍💻

This is an open invitation to aspiring enthusiasts, offering a platform to explore, innovate, and craft projects centered around the theme of music. Whether you're a total beginner or a total chad with a passion for melodies (not the candy), this hackathon promises an unforgettable journey of learning, collaboration, and creativity. 👾

Unleash your imagination, blend technology with harmonies, and breathe life into your musical aspirations. Join us in this very cool and very fun celebration of music.🎶✨

Learn from GSoC, and LFX alumni 🎓from our college
as they share their journeys, challenges, and key lessons from contributing to open-source projects.

Explore GSoC, MLH, LFX, and Outreachy projects
with guidance from our Core Team. Learn how to contribute and propose projects.

Clueless.
Absolutely clueless.
Feeling majorly lost and slightly annoyed...

...pretty much sums up how you're going to feel half of the time in your software development journey. We, at OSDC, have decided to embrace this process of finding yourself lost in uncharted territories and figuring a way out for yourself. 

Join us on March 18th for a digital treasure hunt of our own where we'll have you working with *loads* of technologies and getting familiar with adapting to the unknown. 

Irrespective of your technical prowess, we'll have you:
- set-up development environments
- fix bugs
- troubleshoot linux systems 
- find flags 
- and expose you to a lot of different technologies you may not have come across before

Register at https://ossdevs.com (link in bio) for the event, people can participate solo or in teams of 2. 

May the fastest googler win!

Hey folks!
Calling all code-savvy college students! The Open Source Development Community (OSDC) is thrilled to host a meet-up talk that's sure to be a real "source" of inspiration. Our next meet-up will be all about Google Summer of Code (GSOC), and we'll show you how to "git" involved.

The event will take place on "January 27th", at "CL-01," “17:00” onwards. Our guest speaker, Pranshu Srivastava, an experienced GSOCer and currently a developer at @redhatinc , will share his insights and tips on how to make the most of the programme. Additionally, we will have a panel of past GSOC students who will share their experiences and answer questions.

This is a great opportunity for anyone interested in open source development and looking for a chance to gain valuable experience and contribute to the community. Don't "bug" out on this opportunity to learn from experts and network with other students.

Hello there! 🤠
Are you, or someone you know, a beginner in tech, and want to participate in hackathons?
Do you currently lack the skillset or idea pool to get started hacking?
Or do you struggle finding teammates to group up with?

We are pleased to announce the third iteration of OSDCodeJam! 🥳

OSDCodeJam is JODC and OSDC's yearly entry-level hackathon (well, not strictly). Unlike other hackathons, participants here register individually and are grouped into teams, by us, based on their skills and experience to make sure teams are on equal footing. Each team has a period of 5 days to make a project on a theme, which'll be announced beforehand. 🌙 

CodeJam is a great learning experience, especially if you're a beginner since we believe there's always something to bring to the table 🪑.
As usual, the Jam will be hosted over GitHub which also means that it'll be a great way to learn tools like Git, which are essential for any software developer's journey. More importantly, it'll be an opportunity to interact and collaborate with new people as you learn together, have fun and build something exciting by the end of it. 🛠️ 

The jamming period will be from January 9 - January 13, with fun daily quizzes!

For all the details, check out the repository for the Jam at https://codejam.ossdevs.com/

Registrations are open till January 5, 2023. Head over to https://ossdevs.com/ for the registration link.
 
For any queries, feel free to reach out to us on our Discord/Telegram. We'll be happy to help! Links at -  https://ossdevs.com

P.S. All links are in bio!

Hi folks! 👋

Coming Tuesday (18th October), we, the Open Source Developers Community (OSDC) will be conducting a talk on "TEXTING: Text Editors and IDE's".

These are the basic tools, your magic wands if you may, that you will be using in your journey as a computer science student (and upcoming professional). Languages may come and go, but text editors remain constant (kinda).

Getting confused about the text editor you should start your developer journey with? 
Don't know how to set up your IDE for your use case?

Don't worry! In this talk, we'll be going over:

- A basic introduction of some popular Text Editors and IDE's
 - VSCode
 - (Neo)vim
 - Sublime Text
- How to get started
- Setup
- Some Tips and Tricks 

You'll be up to speed with all the information you'll need to pick what's best for you and setup you dream environment. ⌨️✨

We will also be having an online session on the coming Saturday (22nd October, 2022) on Vim (extremely powerful text editor) and how to get started with it.

Details - 
Venue - CL4 (below LRC)
Time - 5:00 P.M. onwards
Date - Tuesday, 18th October, 2022

Hi folks! 👋

It's Hacktober month! ✨

Coming Tuesday (11th October), we, the Open Source Developers Community (OSDC) will be talking about Hacktoberfest, which is a month-long, international celebration of open-source projects, to spread awareness and encourage people to contribute to OSS in the month of October!

Don't know how to get started?
Don't know what 'Git', 'GitHub', or 'Pull Requests' are? 

Don't worry! We got your back. We'll be going over some basic concepts on how to use Git/GitHub before showing off Hacktoberfest and telling you how you can kickstart your journey in open source and stand a chance to earn schwags by contributing! 🚀

Be sure to bring your laptops since we'll be having a hands-on demonstration.

Details - 
Venue - Lab CL1 (Near LRC)
Time - 5:00 P.M. onwards
Date - Tuesday, 11th October, 2022

@no_faksh

Hey folks! 👋
Have you ever try to look under the hood of a compilation process? How does your source code get compiled?
How does your machine understand your code? Magic ✨? Have you ever taken a look at compilers other than GCC or Microsoft Visual C/C++?

Modern day production quality compilers are enormously complex pieces of software that require a lot of background knowledge to tinker with. This can make it daunting for newcomers like us to break into the field of compiler design. 

Join JODC + OSDC for a talk centred around few important questions such as: 
- Why are compilers important?
- Where are they used?
- How does a compiler break down code into machine instructions?

This talk is for anyone who wants to know about compilers and about LLVM Open Source Compiler Infrastucture which powers various programming languages like C/C++, Fortran, Julia, Rust, Swift and more! 😎

Date: Wednesday, 24th August 2022
Time: 10:00 P.M.
Meet Link: https://meet.jit.si/OSDCMeetup (Online)
Fill out the form: https://forms.gle/ByX3XdvDx8XAuZup6

(Links in bio)

DevOps, a field that has been just as much overlooked as it's crucial to development.
Despite its recent surge in popularity, DevOps still retains an air of mystery about it for a lot of people. (Spoiler - Not a first-person shooter game)

This week's talk aims at debunking it. On top of getting a clear idea of just what DevOps is about, you'll also learn about various DevOps processes like automation, CI/CD pipelines etc. followed by a practical demonstration of basic CI/CD pipelines, Github-actions.

So join in this Friday to an exciting meetup/talk. Look forward to seeing you there!

Date: Friday, 19th August 2022
Time: 6:00 P.M.
Links for the meetup and form for Google Calendar invite are at ossdevs.com (Link in bio)

.
.

P.S. Thank you for the poster @sritama_10!

Hello there!
OSDC/JODC is back with another cool meetup, this time on OSINT, Shodan and more!

You'll learn how to stalk people more effectively (and legally), view and control open cameras around the globe, explore unconventional websites as they take a stand against today's commercially saturated web and get more skilled at Googling your issues when other skills fail you (+appreciate just how rad Pepsi's website used to look back in 1996 (⌐■_■)).

You'll find various fun resources that allow you to do things you had no idea were possible, become aware of the struggle to keep creativity and imagination alive in today's web and learn how to git gud at using it.

Join us for a fun talk this Friday as we explore all these and more, look forward to seeing you there!
Date: 29 July 2022
Time: 6:00 P.M.
Link: https://meet.jit.si/OSDCMeetup
Fill out the form:  https://forms.gle/yDRz1UtGKhi9LSyG9 if you’d like to receive google calendar invite for the meetup.

*Link in bio*

The Open Source Developers Community is an initiative by the students of JIIT to promote open source culture. The hub is all about contributing to and collaborating on projects, networking, learning together and guiding each other.

We are a community of web developers, android freaks, machine learning enthusiasts, hackers, designers, game developers and most significantly, explorers.

Here at OSDC, we are driven towards promoting Open Source far and wide, in an effort to enhance learning in a much more creative way through community projects, workshops, talks and now even conferences!

Farewell seniors 💫

Mr. Backman💪
The man who always got the back of The Thespian Circle. No matter how low you are or how demotivated you feel he would always find a way to motivate you and keep the Josh High. He is a true team player and always believes in the spirit of teamwork and collaboration🔥
He has constantly been a guiding soul and his charismatic presence has always inspired us to bring the best out of each other. Be his powerful Pep talk before any major event or his fun and frolic nature in the parties he's just a complete balance of discipline and enjoyment✨
We bid Shivam Sir a very deephearted farewell and wish that he keeps machaoing Dhoom Dham in his Life!!!💥

The man whose presence is awaited in every party,  who balanced the moye moye of academia with the vibrant chaos of Thespian, he was the glue that held us together, always ready with a joke to lighten the mood and a dedication that inspired us all✨ 
Within the world of The Thespian Circle, he was the brilliant architect of our narratives, crafting stories that captured hearts and minds with his flair for scripting and boundless creativity. Agar Thespian nostalgic hai toh kya nostalgia Thespianic hai?🫡
So with a heavy heart we bid adieu to Vedant Sir. Your infectious humour, astute evaluations and convivial guidance have been invaluable to the hub❤️

Lekhak Sahab✒️
If writing is an art, then he is the Picasso. The person who created magic with his lines and dialogues and added fine layers to the script making process with his wisdom and craft🔥
He always brought a plethora of energy on the meets and had been an active part of the splendid writting work of this hub✨
We wish our writer Sahab, Drishtant Sir a very genuine farewell and may he keep on creating fire with his kalam!!!❤️

The maestro of music and the heart & soul of the Jamming sessions of thespian club, the one who always tangles our heart strings with his melodious voice and tunes that always bring a refreshing vibe to the meets and who always stood as a pillar for all the musical work of the hub✨🎼
Here's wishing Arnav Sir aka DJ Mukesh a very heartfelt farewell and wish him to just keep rocking!!!❤️

Saying goodbye to Bhavika Taneja, our guiding star at The Thespian Circle, feels bittersweet. Her gentle hand and encouraging words have shaped us as performers and individuals. Through her steady guidance, she illuminated the path of creativity for us, making every rehearsal and performance memorable✨
Her presence, both on and off the stage, has left an indelible mark on our hearts. Her patient mentorship and digital prowess behind the scenes have made our journey richer. 
As we bid farewell to a remarkable mentor and friend, we carry with us the lessons learned and the memories shared, forever grateful for her impact on our theatrical journey❤️

We bid farewell to Chaitanya Yadav, a cornerstone of our Thespian Circle✨ 
From managing the chaos behind the scenes with the last minute "koi scene nhi hai" to gracing the stage with undeniable charisma, his impact on our performances and community has been immeasurable. His cool demeanor and unwavering dedication have set a standard that will be hard to match💫
As we bid adieu, we reflect on the laughter shared, the challenges overcome, and the countless memories etched in the spotlight❤️

We bid farewell to our incredible musician, the djembe clad warrior Pranav Chopra whose melodies have been the heart of The Thespian Circle, weaving magic into our performances and setting the vibe during every rehearsal🪘 
From the first note to the last bow, you have been an indelible pillar of TTC. Thank you for the countless hours you've spent perfecting your craft, for the energy you've poured into every performance, and for always being there when needed💫
As you embark on your next journey, know that you carry with you the love, admiration, and best wishes of everyone at The Thespian Circle❤️

We bid farewell to Kashish Saluja Ma'am🫶
A sweet and caring heart, a joy we inherit.
Your laughter and kindness, the way you greet, a beacon of light,
In every moment, you made our Thespian journey bright.
Your happy soul, a treasure so rare,
In every smile, we felt your care.
Though you move on, your legacy stays,
A senior so dear, in countless ways.
Wishing you joy as you spread your wings💫
From conquering the stage together to countless memories shared, your leadership and team spirit have always shone bright. Thank you for your last minute monologues, late night coffee treats and most of all thank you for being the heart of our Thespian Family and making our journey soo beautiful and memorable with your love and care,we'll miss you ❤️

We bid farewell to Rohit Kansal, the unwavering pillar of The Thespian Circle. His stern guidance, exceptional organizational skills, and tireless efforts to keep everything running smoothly were instrumental in our success✨

He was a mentor who kept everyone in line, ensuring that even the smallest details were meticulously handled. His ability to get items approved and his dedication to overcoming any challenges that came our way were invaluable with his iconic dialogue "2 din pehle list de dena", not only managing the hub but also showcasing his prowess in acting and 'lafda handling'🥰

Rohit sir, you have been the backbone of The Thespian Circle, and your contributions have helped us thrive. As you move on to new ventures, know that you will always be remembered with deep gratitude and respect. Thank you for everything, and you will be greatly missed!❤️

It's not the goodbye that hurts but the flashback that follows🥺
As we bid farewell to our incredible seniors, our hearts are filled with gratitude and admiration for the legacy they leave behind. From the countless hours of rehearsals to the unforgettable performances that graced our stage, each of you has played an instrumental role in shaping TTC into the vibrant society it is today. 
Though we'll miss your presence on and off the stage, we are excited to see where your talents and dreams take you💫
Break a leg in all your future endeavors! The world is your stage, and we are your biggest fans❤️

We are thrilled to announce the newest additions to our dramatic family!✨
A big congratulations to everyone who made it here🎉
You've signed up for an incredible ride full of rehearsals, laughter, and unforgettable moments!!🙌
We hope you will bring honor and glory to our vibrant hub💫
Let's embark on this adventure together❤️

Missed the chance to audition for The Thespian Circle last semester? Worry not!
We're thrilled to invite you all to our Re-Auditions. A day full of with quirky conversations, interesting personalities, and captivating drama awaits✨
It's your opportunity to unleash your inner artist, revel in the joy of acting, and make unforgettable memories. Come, showcase your passion, and seize the chance to join our vibrant family❤️

Here are a few things to keep in mind:
1.  Auditions are open only to first-year students (regardless of the course).
2. Students auditioning for acting should perform mono, duo, or group acts (max 5 members). Each individual must fill out the form separately.
3. Those auditioning for scriptwriters, creatives, and digital roles, please come prepared with samples of your work.
4. Instrumentalists should bring their instruments along.
5. Being pre-prepared will give you an edge, but we'll also provide scripts/ideas to perform.
6. Even if you have no prior experience, come and explore—it'll be a fun interaction for everyone!

Date: 19th March, 2024
Time: 5:00 p.m.

Form link in bio🔗
See you all at the auditions!!

In silence thrives, a script fuels his soul,
A guiding light, making the team whole.
 
Beneath his introverted demeanour lies a passion for art that ignites a fire within, fuelling his creativity and setting the stage for extraordinary masterpieces. With a brilliant mind, he tackles challenges with strategic prowess, transforming obstacles into opportunities. From silent strength to bold leadership, his impact shines Bright! In the spotlight of solitude, he spins scripts that enchant. With passion as his guiding star, he fearlessly navigates the turbulent waters of tough decisions, knowing that the collective success of his team depends on his unwavering leadership.
 
Sir, as you step into the next phase of your life, we wish you all the success and happiness in the world. Farewell, and may your future be filled with endless opportunities and accomplishments. 😶‍🌫️🕺🎭🍾🥰

Bravo to our sensational seniors! 🎭💫 As the curtains close on this chapter, we celebrate the unforgettable performances, the creative brilliance, and the camaraderie that brought us together. From intense rehearsals to show-stopping acts, each moment holds a special place in our hearts. Their talent and passion have inspired us beyond measure, and we’ll forever treasure the memories on and off the stage. As they take center stage in their own stories, we bid them a dramatic farewell with thunderous applause! 👏🌟

In the spotlight, he ascends, his energy taking flight,
Funky drama maven, dazzling with pure delight.
 
A few sessions in and it becomes abundantly clear that there was no other quite like him. With an enchanting aura that lit ups every room, he effortlessly weaves magic into every moment. His passion for his craft is unparalleled, an inspiration to us all to pursue our dreams wholeheartedly and without reservation. His ability to leave everyone around him enthralled and enamored is truly is gift. Through his dedication and relentless pursuit of excellence, he has elevated Thespian’s artistic endeavors to new heights.
Fond Farewell to our Charismatic Maverick! Sir, your infectious energy, exceptional talent, and unwavering passion have left an unforgettable mark on us all. Cheers to the memories shared and the brilliance that lies ahead! 🪘🕺🎭🍾❤️

With a sugary charm, she spreads love's art,

In party's embrace, her acting steals every heart.

 

Being around her is like delving into the extraordinary life of a person who embodies sweetness, sass, and everything in between.She takes center stage in a whirlwind of vibrant parties and extravagant adventures. With a penchant for exploration, she embraces every journey with unbridled enthusiasm, adding her signature touch of luxury to each trip, making memories that shine like diamonds.With every performance, she paints the stage with hues of emotion, leaving audiences awe-inspired and moved. Her insightful suggestions breathe life into endeavors, turning potential into outstanding performances.

Ma'am as we bid you farewell, we treasure the memories of laughter, camaraderie, and your extraordinary talent.  We hope that your adventures ahead will be as spectacular as you are.🛍️🎒💰💕

"Farewell to our amazing senior, the drama maestros of our college! 🎭🎉 As they take their final bow, we cherish the memories created together on this dramatic journey. Thank you for inspiring us with your talent, dedication, and creativity. 🌟 Best of luck for your future endeavors!

In strict embrace, a heart of gold,
Orchestrating brilliance, stories to be told.
If she was to be described in a sentence it would be "she is a package of strict embrace with a heart of gold, she orchestrates brilliance, a force to behold". Her strict embrace combined with her love weaves a web of unity, keeping every member in sync. We have embraced the funk of her fierce leadership, as she instruments events with a harmonious blend of love and power, leaving a trail of awe and admiration. On several occasions she has proven her prowess as she transformed chaos to harmony, leading with love and unwavering strength.

Ma’am your impact on our hub will forever be a source of inspiration. As you bid adieu, know that you leave behind a legacy of excellence and camaraderie.

With a chai lover's zest and sweet nature's grace,
Adventures ahead, her kind spirit will embrace.
 
She owns a pleasant personality with a wonderful ability to encourage hearts, and support dreams! She is a funky teamster with a heart of gold. With every word she uplifts hearts and spreads joy like a contagious melody. She resonates celebration of teamwork, where funky vibes intertwine with unity, crafting a story of togetherness and spreading love wherever she goes.With a wealth of experiences at her disposal, she remains grounded and humble, captivating everyone with her remarkable acting talent.
As the curtains draw close on this chapter, we bid a bittersweet farewell to our enchanting star. Ma'am your sweet presence, infectious laughter, and kind-heartedness are adored by us all.

In the spotlight, her passion blooms,
A glamorous soul, partying under moonlit plumes.
 
Meet the life of every bash, a party-animal with an unmatched passion for acting and a flair for glamour that combines with her energy to dazzle every scene. Outspoken and vivacious, she commands attention with her sweet voice and fun-loving spirit. A vibrant fusion of fun and fitness, celebrating life with a sparkling mix of glitz, glee, and unstoppable passion, she's the star of every gathering.
Her fun-loving nature and outspoken charm make her the center of attention, leaving no room for dull moments.
With heavy hearts, we bid adieu to our sensational star. Ma'am your vivacious presence, unwavering passion for acting, and zest for life have left an unforgettable mark on our hearts.🍾💃🥗🥰

In pixels and soundwaves, his brilliance beams,

Crafting digital artistry, fueling his artistic dreams.

Step into the world of theater and showcase your acting skills at the Rangmanch Competition, presented by The Thespian Circle. This is the perfect opportunity to take the stage and show off your talent as an actor. Get ready for an unforgettable evening of captivating performances that will leave you on the edge of your seat!

The Thespian Circle is dedicated to fostering a love of theater and providing opportunities for aspiring actors to develop their craft. This competition is designed to encourage artistic expression and creativity while bringing together like-minded individuals who share a passion for the performing arts.

As a participant, you will have the opportunity to showcase your talent in front of a live audience and be judged by a panel of experts in the industry. Whether you're a seasoned actor or new to the world of theater, this competition is open to all who are willing to take on the challenge.

Join us for an evening of excitement, drama, and entertainment, as each contestant takes the stage to showcase their talent and vie for the top prize in the Rangmanch Competition. Whether you prefer comedy, drama, or something in between, you're sure to be entertained by the variety of performances on offer.

So, step up to the challenge, perfect your performance, and get ready to take center stage at this year's Rangmanch Competition presented by The Thespian Circle. Don't miss out on this opportunity to showcase your acting skills and be a part of an unforgettable theatrical experience! 

#RangmanchCompetition #TheaterLife #ActingSkills #thethespiancircle

Are you ready for a night of laughter and entertainment? Join The Thespian Circle for a special bonus performance at Impression'23 called 'Not a Mushaira?' This unique comedy show promises to be a night of unforgettable entertainment that's not to be missed!

The Thespian Circle is committed to providing innovative and engaging performances that showcase the best of what the performing arts have to offer. 'Not a Mushaira?' is a perfect example of this, as it combines traditional poetry readings with modern humor to create a show that's both original and hilarious.

So, if you're looking for a night of entertainment that's unlike anything you've ever experienced before, be sure to join us for 'Not a Mushaira?' at Impression'23. Get ready to laugh, be entertained, and have an unforgettable night of comedy with The Thespian Circle. Don't miss out on this exciting and unique performance! 

#NotAMushaira #ComedyNight #TheThespianCircle #Impression23

Attention all aspiring actors and performers! The Thespian Circle is proud to present the Abhijay Monoact Competition at this year's college fest, Impression'23. This competition is the perfect opportunity to showcase your individual talents and captivate an audience with a solo performance that will leave them breathless.

We believe that the Abhijay Monoact Competition is an excellent platform for artistic expression and creativity, and we encourage all students to participate. Whether you're a seasoned performer or a newcomer to the stage, this competition is open to all who are willing to take on the challenge.

As a participant, you will have the chance to bring a character to life and engage an audience with your unique style and interpretation. Whether you prefer drama, comedy, or something in between, we welcome all genres of performance.

Join us for a thrilling and unforgettable evening of performances, as each contestant takes the stage to showcase their talent and vie for the top prize in the Abhijay Monoact Competition. This is an excellent opportunity to hone your skills, gain valuable experience, and develop a love of theater.

So, dust off your monologue, perfect your delivery, and get ready to take center stage at Impression'23. We look forward to seeing you there! 

Form link for registration in bio📝

The wait is finally over!!
The Thespian Circle, the dramatics society of JIIT,62 is here with its much awaited orientation. 
 
After the vapid break of two years, we artists are eagerly waiting to demonstrate our showmanship and give you guys a glimpse of The Thespian Circle.
Whether you are an experienced actor or you have never been on stage before or consider yourself as an admirer of theatre and art, this orientation can be your gateway to an unexplored world of fun and glory. 

Sounds exciting right? Then look no further, leave the monotony of your rooms and join us on 18th November, 5pm at LT-1. All the world's a stage and we want you to be a part of it.
See you there ✨✨

With eyes full of excitement and heart full of warmth, The Thespian Circle welcomed the freshers with fun interactive induction programme on 23rd September, 2022. Skits, standup, play "Gajra Mohobbat Wala" and limitless fun and banter were the highlights of the event.
With naye naye sapne and haule haule gaata dil, we welcome you Juniors✨✨

A man full of wit and vision in his eyes;
One rarely meets someone both childish and wise. 
Mazin Sir, the person who can illuminate the inkiest of the situation with his presence.
A joyful and savvy leader with a thing for politics and music.
He is a piece of gem or rather an entire pandora box full of optimism, surprises, hope, love, rants, and many more.
Undoubtedly he is the perfect example of an exciting senior whom everyone loves.
Sir, we love you and hope the best of things await you ahead.

He wears on his head the crown of poetry;
He is a brave heart, firm yet soft and carefree.
Muaz Sir, the guy who keeps literature in his left pocket and theater in the right. 
He can be the most elegant speaker and the jolliest guy in the group at the same time.
With his unique charm, he keeps the environment full of fun and laughter.
His poems and his euphonious voice are loved and admired by everyone.
Sir, we love you from within and wish you the best for your future.

He believes in himself, and aims to reach the sky;
And inspires others, giving them wings to fly.
When things didn't go as planned when the skies fell in silence, we looked back for help, we found Mayank Sir.
He is not just an epitome of talent but a thread who knows exactly how to weave strong bonds.
He is the center that aligns the team into a curve-"a circle" in its true sense. 
His dedication to work coupled with a plethora of patience makes him the coolest guy in the group.
Sir, we love you from within and wish you immense success ahead.

He spellbound everyone with his melodious voice;
With his company and amiability, we all rejoice.
Arjun Sir, the heart of the Thespian circle, beats rhythmically to cheer his friends and lyrically when it comes to his heart.
He is truly dedicated to his work, not only by heart but with a lot of smart work embedded into it. 
He has been a friend, a companion, and an amiable person to be with throughout. 
Sir, we all love you and send you tons of best wishes for your prosperous life ahead.
There are things, there are thoughts and then there are you guys , Things that are not so usual but we know they are true.

Readily tackles all the hurdles on his own;
A man of skills he is, our gem stone.
Vivek sir is an energetic person with extraordinary skills and abundance of stories to share. 
He has the magical ability to lighten up the most stressful situations with his fun and frolics.
He has worked conscientiously and made amazing posters and bonds that we all love.
Sir, we love you and wish you a prosperous life ahead.

Handling all the chaos with a calm smile;
He never breaks the bond of trust so fragile.
Yash sir's actions speak louder than his words and his diligence never fails to surprise us.
He holds an amazing perspective on challenges and paves his way towards excellence.
Sir, we wish you the best in your future endeavors.

Twirling all around singing her happy songs;
Holds a special place there, to our hearts she belongs.
Nandini ma'am has a magnificent aura and is sweeter than honey.
She is always there to help others and her creativity amuses us all.
Ma'am, we wish you warm regards and a successful life ahead.

He owns a noble heart and great convincing powers;
His spirit blossoms are as bright as flowers.
Harsh sir is a worldly man with a lot of capabilities and a heart of gold. 
He handles his responsibilities with utmost ease, his cheerful behavior radiates positivity in the group.
Sir, we wish you warm regards and successful life ahead.

Owning a brave spirit and the kindest heart;
She leaves a legacy behind her as she departs.
With her pleasant personality and bubbly nature, Priyanka ma'am is loved by all.
She sparkles like a star and is one of those whom everyone would like to bond with for a long time.
Ma'am, we wish you the best for your future.

And here comes that time of the year, that we wish never came. 
When we bid you farewell, with teary eyes and heart full of pain.
From teaching us to respect the legacy to handing it over to us, we will forever be grateful to you. Thank you for being the most amazing seniors.
Thank you for all the love and affection that you have given us. A heartiest farewell to the most cheerful, talented and extremely supportive batch!
You guys are unparalleled and we will miss you immensely.

No matter how dim the situation may be;
She cheers everyone up with her chirping melody.
If you are looking for a bundle of talent and energy, that means you are looking for Damyanti ma'am.
She can tackle any hurdle effortlessly with her productive attitude and her work ethic never fail to empower us.
Ma'am, we wish you immense success ahead.

He needs no explanation, he is here to excel;
Watch before you leap for he knows his moves well.
Akash sir never fails to impress us with his lively personality.
His energy is infectious and everyone around him can feel it flowing in them.
Sir, we wish you warm regards and successful life ahead.

Those laughing eyes with sunny beam;
We adore that smile filled with joyous gleam.
We are all amazed by the constant dedication that Shubh sir exhibits.
With his meticulous attitude, he tackles every hardship with a smile on his face.
Sir, we wish you immense success ahead.

When in dark, you have been our guide;
You always inspire us to be the group's pride.
Shubham sir has taken every challenge head-on and outlined the meaning of what it takes to be a true artist.
His indefatigable spirit and wonderful personality are too good to be measured in words. 
Sir, we wish you the best for your future endeavors.

The Thespian Circle - Dramatics society of JIIT 62 is once again here with its second leg of  auditions. We officially call for Actors, Scriptwriters, Instrumentalists, Vocalist, Creative, Design, Management to join us on 16 May 2022,Monday . 
TIME: 5 PM
VENUE: LT 3

So, what are you waiting for?Register ASAP.
Looking forward to see you all and we are eager to see you perform!
Lights, Camera and Action!!

General Guidelines

1. Have to perform mono, duo or group act (max 5 members) still the form has to be filled individually.
2. People who are planning to audition for script writers, creative, digital it would be really great if you can come prepared with a few samples of work.
3. All those who are willing to audition for instrumentalists have to bring their instruments along..
4. Coming self prepared will be given an edge but we will also provide you the scripts/ideas to perform.
5. We are conducting acting, script writing, vocalist and instrumentalists auditions on 16th May, Monday 5pm and other departments like management, creative, digital interviews on 18th May, Wednesday 5pm.

When life gives you a hard time but you still keep a straight face on, when all hell breaks loose and you still have the guts to say "Bring it on", that's the glory that The Thespian Circle headed by the coordinators live by and would want you to learn the same.
Presenting to you our coordinators for 2021-22.
Here’s to breaking all the rules and to everlasting spirits that just won't give up.
With immense love and pride, The Thespian Circle Dramatics Society JIIT’62 presents to you The Council 2021-22

When life gives you a hard time but you still keep a straight face on, when all hell breaks loose and you still have the guts to say "Bring it on", that's the glory that The Thespian Circle headed by the coordinators live by and would want you to learn the same.
Presenting to you our coordinators for 2021-22.
Here’s to breaking all the rules and to everlasting spirits that just won't give up.

There had to be a place to ideate, shout out loud, and take a stand, so here we are with the most enthralling genre of theatre -Street Play.

Jump on board as we take this journey through the streets and induce empathy, plurality, and social awareness amongst the masses.

The Thespian Circle - Dramatics society of JIIT 62 officially calls for Actors, Writers, Musicians, Editors, Graphic Designers, management and production members(& most importantly people who want to learn) at campus on 29th and 30th of November. 
Whether you possess an innate interest in the intricacies of theatre or have never seen even a school play, as long as you have a shade of enthusiasm and a drive to learn that which is new and thrilling, THE THESPIAN CIRCLE IS THE PLACE FOR YOU!

(For all those who are online and can't come at campus on 29th and 30th of november- auditions will be conducted next semester)

General Guidelines

1. Have to perform mono, duo or group act (max 5 members) still the form has to be filled individually.
2. People who are planning to audition for script writers, creative, digital it would be really great if you can come prepared with a few samples of work.
3. All those who are willing to audition for instrumentalists have to bring their instruments along..
4. Coming self prepared will be given an edge but we will also provide you the scripts/ideas to perform.
5..Due to covid restrictions in place at campus you will be given individual time slots.

Seeing Covid restrictions still in place at campus, we request you to arrive at the venue within the allotted time slot only. Venue and slots will be communicated to you through mails.

Our mental health includes our psychological, emotional and social well-being. It also affects the way we feel, act and think. Mental health is as important as our physical health. If a person has a positive mental health attitude and approach, it allows them to work productively, realize their full potential, cope up with the stressors and also make meaningful contributions to their communities. It is okay not be okay sometimes but, it is not okay to stay not okay. Even if you have a mental illness, it is nothing to be ashamed of, but the stigma and bias shame us all eventually. 

In collaboration with @beyondmeds.in

You all made it so easy for us to say Hello!!
that even the thought of goodbye aches our hearts.
Cheers to the hope that we will meet soon🥂

We can't imagine not seeing you around at the campus,
your loving gestures, your encouraging smiles,

We never told you this,
but we knew whenever where ever we will be trapped you would be there to take us out.

You taught us the importance of exploring different spheres
and of course, we always wanted to be as cool as our seniors.

We miss seeing you all at the JBS every day,
the things you all used to say have suddenly become so much special for us.

The jamming sessions, parties, fights
we were so lost in the moments
that it all got over in the blink of an eye.

Just wanted to hug you and say;
we will be there for you
like you were there for us.

As you always said
We aren't just a hub
We are a family.

COMPETITION EXTENDED TILL 5TH OCT
Hey guys!
By this time you must be aware about "Who we are" and "What we do", now here comes a chance for you  to showcase your talent infront of the whole college, your first opportunity to become a part of our ENERGETIC and DRAMATIC family!

The Thespian Circle, dramatics society of JIIT'62 presenting  you the virtual extravaganza
DRAMFLIX - THE VIDEO COMPETITION

The competition will be held on our instagram handle and winners of the same will ADVANCE directly to the SECOND ROUND OF THE AUDITIONS!
Also, The winning video will be uploaded from the youtube channel of The Thespian Circle
So gear up and send us a video (vines, reels, instrumentals, narratives, open mic, monologues, mimicry, etc)

RULES ARE AS FOLLOWS:
•Go Solo
•Time limit: 15-240 secs
•The winner will be selected on the basis of the following parameters
-LIKES (2 points)
-COMMENTS (3 points) 
-SHARES (5 points) (Do tag TTC page on the shared post to get it notified by our team)
-EDITOR's choice (10 points)
So show us as many expressions and versatility as much as you can

Use of any external apps for boosting likes will lead to direct DISQUALIFICATION

Use of any cheap/vulgar language will lead to direct DISQUALIFICATION

EXCEEDING THE TIME LIMIT WILL LEAD TO NEGATIVE MARKING

Send us your video's google drive link at: ttcjiit@gmail.com
Along with the name, enrollment no, mobile no, Instagram and Facebook handles.
For any queries contact - 8795219935

Aabhar Dev or The Expression King!
He is a kind of an actor who taught us how to live a character. He has been part of almost all the plays either as an actor or a mentor. Once you tell him a character and the kind of a role he gets into it in a snap and doesn't gets out of it until the applause stops. He has performed some most dominant roles as 'Tilasmi' and 'Satta' in our street plays and lived them so perfectly that we are still not able to find even a substitue for these roles. He seems to be the most quite person when in the team but he is the best ever companion for any mischief you have if he opens up to you. You can never get bored with him as he is a perfect blend of fun and seriousness.
Idolize him for the sincerity.

It’s never easy to say goodbye to people you care about, but finding the right words to express how you feel can make the transition smoother and more memorable.
Sir, our team wouldn't have been the way it is without a compassionate and supportive leader as you. You've always been the one bridging gaps among us. Be it the strict sessions where you used to criticize us for being casual, or your super sarcastic remarks, it has always been a pleasure to be guided by you. Even though your straightforward attitude and last minute change of plans maddened us, but deep inside we knew that you had always wanted to bring out the best in us. 
We couldn't be more thankful to you for your endless support and healthy criticism. You're one gem of a person and have managed everything so well. We'll miss you.

Yash Saxena, He is one of the most fun loving humans you will ever get to be around. Also the stud boy of the thespian circle. He is always there for you, no matter what even if he isn’t present there physically, he is just a call away. He has always guided everyone and always been welcoming with any problem anyone ever had. He is not just good looking, but also an amazing actor and whatever role he gets, he gives it his all. He has been known for a number of roles weather be it Arjun, birbal and also a great improv actor. He is the most helpful person you will ever meet and we will miss you. It won’t be the same without you.
No caption available

Dhawal Ambokar, also known as "Rajesh" has truly taken the hub to greater heights. From "Praful" to "Rajesh", his his comic timing has definitely improved our "body circulation".
He has written several marvellous plays, it was his direction that enabled us to win awards and hearts. He always ensured that no one is left behind in the process of play making and made sure that everyone learns and grows. A fierce critic who ensured that all our plays achieved perfection and never hesitated to go the extra mile to ensure that, always keeping the hub before himself. We will always cherish and miss his scripts and how his pen has given life to many characters.
At times he would enlighten us with his deep knowledge of drama and the next moment would crack us up with his sarcastic jokes and one would never know he's joking if it wasn't accompanied by his even more sarcastic laugh! We are sure going to spend a hard time filling up his shoes. 
It was truly an enlightening journey working with you, and we wish you keep inspiring people! All the best for your future endeavours. We are sure you will achieve success wherever you will go. The Thespian Circle will miss it's "Rajesh"

Probably the most versatile artist this hub has ever seen. Be it acting, scriptwriting or giving background scores he can do it all. The source of all good vibes, Adarsh sir never hesitated to perform unconventional roles on the stage. From being as fun as 'Hansa' to being as fierce as 'Hafiz' , Adarsh sir never failed to deliver and always left the audience in awe. An efficient worker,a wise mentor, a gentle soul and a great friend. It is always fun to have him around. The Thespian Circle will always remember it's Murliwadak.

Shadan Ali is one of the most talented actor and the most versatile actor of the thespian circle. He has shown great variations in hos roles from Lord Ram to King Akbar to a small insect. He picks up the most difficult roles to play which no one else can play and has always done justice to them. He is  a good mentor and he does not leave you behind until you perfectly get into the character. He is such a generous and a kind hearted person that he cannot see anyone sad. He is a joyful and a fun loving person and he creates an enlivening atmosphere whenever he is around. He is a funny person and we  rarely see him tensed.  We are very lucky that we could work with him and bidding him farewell would be very tough for us.

Best people embodies both sides, everyone out there know him as a polite and jolly person but when it came to work and functioning we have seen his fierce personality too. A man of utmost sincerety, despite being a day scholar he was there with us in almost every workshop. We will always remember him as a man who never fell short of ideas, who always motivated us when we were even scared of giving auditions, everytime we were stuck, he made things easy just by saying "achcha esa Kar sakta Hain", will miss the hope induced by his voice.

The Thespian Circle presents it's annual street production of 2019 "Shhh..." highlighting many topics under sex education and its importance in India. 
The play had light comedy and satire on the knowledge and practices in society. It is about how adolescent boys shape their perception about girls and women, if misleaded from media which is usually their source of information. Not only is having access to sex education that is comprehensive a human right, it's our fundamental duty as a society to educate the next generation.

Congratulations to all the students for successfully clearing round 1 of the auditions. All the mentioned students are supposed to be present on Thursday, 5th September 2019 at JBS Atrium at their respective slots and times as mentioned for the workshop.

"We are actors, we are the opposite of people"
To get incorporated in this family of opposites, here is another opportunity for all of you. The first round of offline auditions of The Thespian Circle is scheduled on 4th September 2019. Choose your departments, save the date and be there to reserve a seat in the most enthusiastic hub of our college.
The interviews for departments other than acting and instrumentalists/vocalists are scheduled on 6th September. Filling the provided form is mandatory regardless of whichever department you apply for. Mentioned below are a few things that should be kept in mind:
1. Everyone has to come prepared with an act of 1 to 5 minutes.
2. A group of maximum 5 can perform together, still the form has to be filled individually.
3. All those who are willing to audition for instrumentalists have to bring their instruments along.
4. People who are planning to audition for script writers, come prepared with a few samples of work.

All the best! It's your time to win a standing ovation this time.

Hola freshers!
The wait is finally over!
You guys have seen our acts and performances in our orientation, now here comes a chance for you guys to showcase your talent infront of the whole college, your first opportunity to become a part of our MASTIKHOR, ENERGETIC and DRAMATIC family!

The winner of this online competition will ADVANCE directly to the SECOND ROUND OF THE AUDITIONS!
Also, The winning video will be uploaded from the youtube channel of The Thespian Circle
So gear up and send us a video (Dubsmash, vines, instrumentals,vocals, narratives, shayari, etc)

RULES ARE AS FOLLOWS:
•Team size: 1-6 members
•The winner will be selected on the basis of the following parameters
-LIKES/REACTS (2 points)
-COMMENTS (3 points) -SHARES (10 points) -EDITOR's choice (10 points)
So show us as many expressions and versatility as much as you can

NOTE: likes, comments will only be considered if the person has liked our page first

Use of any external apps for boosting likes will lead to direct DISQUALIFICATION

Use of any cheap/vulgar language will lead to direct DISQUALIFICATION

EXCEEDING THE TIME LIMIT WILL LEAD TO NEGATIVE MARKING

Send us your video at: ttcjiit@gmail.com
Along with the name and enrollment no of your group members

Last date of submission: 25th August, 2019
YOU WILL BE NOTIFIED REGARDING THE OFFLINE AUDITIONS AFTER THE CULMINATION OF THIS CONTEST !! For any further queries contact:
Tanishka Tyagi:9870750876
Apurva Sharma:9917924063

ALL THE BEST!!

Expressions are the key to a good actor and Aabhar Dev is a master of versatile expressions .He is the one who balances out the body language while giving exemplary expressions. He is one of the most cheerful personalities of the hub, the epitome of perfection.

Acting is not being emotional, but being able to fully express emotion.
Shishir Khandelwal with his leadership skills always leads the way. Sometimes lenient sometimes strict he sure does know how to manage things at the time of stress. From comic roles to serious roles he can do it all. The thespian circle is proud of you.

Acting is not being emotional, but being able to fully express emotion.
Yash Saxena- one of the most energetic actor of our hub. Always with a smile on his face,  he spreads positivity everywhere. Be it arjun, birbal or for that matter cock-the-roach he always amazes us with his acting.

"We don't heal in isolation, but in community." Proving this statement unerring by performing his task of keeping the hub together, Ayush Singh, is another name added to the book of the Thespian Circle. Yes we call him the man behind the curtain or the flag bearer of our hub, because all we flourish, we owe it to your management, sir!

Adarsh Singh, just another name for perfection. The skills and versatility gained by this person is unmatchable and incomparable. One of the most talented yet the most down to earth person in The Thespian Circle. It has always been a dream to be like him!

Like every cloud has a silver lining , so does he.
Dhawal Ambokar proved himself by directing and writing majority part of our award winning street and stage plays. He burnt the mid night oil , sacrificing his own personal needs and took the hub to new heights. He is a perfect example to dedication and one man army.
Thanks for your guidance sir.

Acting is behaving truthfully under imaginary circumstances.
Shadan ali-The most versatile actor in the hub who has enacted from the role of an insect to that of raja akbar, every role with utmost sincerity and perfection.He is the one who always  maintins a cheerful environment around him. 
Thanks for being an amazing mentor sir.

The much awaited auditions of The Thespian Circle are happening The registrations will be done on the spot.

The Rules and Regulations are as follows :- First and foremost, we appreciate if you come prepared with your acts/content :- 1) Instrument playing/Acting :-
- All performances can be individual or group performances.
- All performances are expected to be not more than 3 mins (if we like your  act, or there are more elements to it, we may allow you to extend it)
- All intrumentalists are expected to get their own instruments.

2) Script Writing :-
- A topic wil be given on the spot, and a maximum time of 45 mins, will be give to draw content (Poems/Short Stories/Screenplays/etc)
- Previously written content will also be contemplated upon.
- We expect you to be authnetic, in your approach.

3) Management/ Creative/ Video and Photo Editing Applicants need to register separately and will be notified about their audition's procedure on the spot itself.

We are excited to announce a Slogan & Essay Writing Competition . This is your chance to creatively express your thoughts and contribute to a safe, inclusive campus environment. The topic for this event will be released on the spot.

Guidelines:
 Essay: 500-700 words. 
 Slogan: A catchy phrase (max 15 words).
 Both essay & slogan must be submitted together.
 Language: English or Hindi.
 Judging Criteria: Creativity, relevance, clarity, and originality.
 Prizes: Top 3 winners get certificates and direct entry to round 2 of the Jaypee DebSoc auditions.

Tribute to Our General Secretary, Yashvardhan Jain !

For the past two years, our esteemed general secretary has been the driving force behind our debating society. His unmatched managerial skills have steered us through countless successful debates, leaving an indelible mark on our community.

But it’s not just about debates. Our general secretary’s passion for politics and history sets him apart. When he speaks, it’s like opening a time capsule—bridging the past with the present. His insights into historical events and political theories enrich our discussions, adding depth and perspective that only true enthusiasts can provide.

As a mentor, he embodies understanding and compassion. Always ready to lend a helping hand, he guides us with wisdom and patience. His presence in our society is akin to salt in food—subtle yet essential. We owe our unwavering enthusiasm for excellence to their inspiring leadership.

So, let’s embark on this transformative journey together. Let our general secretary’s mentorship unlock our true potential, as we explore the realms of politics, history, and spirited debates. 🌟

We are thrilled to introduce our esteemed President, Shubhranshi Agarwal, a beacon of dedication, leadership, and intellectual prowess at the Jaypee Debsoc!

From achieving her first open break in her debut Hindi Parliamentary Debate to leading by example, Shubhranshi has consistently showcased her exceptional debating skills and unwavering commitment to excellence. Her passion for philosophy and psychology, combined with her deep love for literature and mastery of all debating formats, makes her an inspiring figure for all of us.

Shaping "The New Jaypee Debsoc," Shubhranshi stands as one of the most creative individuals our society has ever seen. With a diverse knowledge spanning from management to digital spheres, she has proven herself in every debating arena. Her fiery speeches in both APDs and Hindi PDs have provided invaluable lessons to all juniors. She has always fought for the society and continues to do so with relentless dedication. As one of the most iconic figures of our Debsoc, Madam President leads our team towards future success and beyond.

Join us in celebrating Shubhranshi's journey and her incredible contributions to the Jaypee Debsoc. Together, let’s continue to strive for excellence and intellectual growth under her exemplary leadership! 🚀✨

We are thrilled to introduce our Vice President, Priyanshu Baswala, a wanna be human, who is looking for strategic insight, and has lost all unwavering enthusiasm.

Serving as our mentor for the 2023-24 tenure, Priyanshu brings vibrant energy to the Debating Society, inspiring us all to achieve exceptional feats. His expertise in conducting Asian Parliamentary Debate (APD) mocks has sharpened our skills and prepared us for competitive excellence. 

Priyanshu's knack for teaching philosophy in an engaging and comprehensible manner has forced us to learn oursleves which then broadened our intellectual horizons and deepened our understanding of complex concepts.

His penchant for posing intriguing questions constantly challenges us to think.

Priyanshu's unique perspective in debates, driven by his critical thinking and curiosity, has taught us to think outside the box. From coaching us in debates to helping with time management and coding he has been a role model for many. 

The "winner gets the Dairy Milk" contests and unique debates he has organized have ignited our passion for debating.

Join us on this exciting journey where we will eat icecream and learn.

“Patience, persistence and perspiration make an unbeatable combination for success.” -Napoleon Hill

Parola stands proud and feels immense pleasure to announce that our Former Director of Parola, Gautam Kumar has proved these words by bagging a placement at Magicpin.✨

Since his 1st year being a member of  The Jaypee Debsoc and further in 2nd year the MUN secretary, by winning countless debates and MUNs he has successfully fostered a sense of belonging and camaraderie among young debators and many literary enthusiasts. His meticulous attention to detail, strategic planning ensured our organisation thrived and flourished. 

Warmest congratulations on securing this role! His determination and commitment has led him to this wonderful new path.
Parola wishes him a very best for his glorious future ahead!🔥

#NewBeginnings #CareerSuccess
#JobPlacement #NextChapter #CareerJourney #joustjiit #AchievementUnlocked #TheJoust2023

"Success is no accident. It is hard work, perseverance, learning, studying, sacrifice and most of all, love of what you are doing or learning to do."- Pele

Parola is elated to share that with his constant endeavor to explore, learn and improve, Amish Mishra, the former Head of Public Relations, has bagged a placement at Oracle.✨

His success isn't just an achievement; it's a testament to his resilience and determination since his days as English PD Secretary at The Jaypee Debsoc. He won many competitions and has taught countless minds about different domains like his expertise -finance & trading. 

Parola bursting with pride congratulates him on this new path and luck for his future ventures.

PART TWELVE: ETHNICITY AND EXTENSION
(END OF CIVILISATION?)

Last Hindu priest refuses to abandon Afghanistan ancestral temple, says 'will consider it Seva even if Taliban kills me.'
Pandit Rajesh Kumar, the last Hindu priest of the Rattan Nath temple, has decided not to leave the country despite being offered help.
Since Afghanistan is no more a safe space for religious minorities, Taliban's capture of Afghanistan is considered as the end of longest civilization which had its roots connected to Hinduism.

PART ELEVEN: WOMEN AND SEXUAL GENDER MINORITIES (SILENCE OR DIE)

Women rights and reforms were appreciated when the country was under the influence of the communists actors, but severely deteriorated when Taliban took over the Afghanistan due to the harsh implementation of the Sharia. As far as gender minorities are concerned, Afghanistan was never and most probably even in the future will be a place for them.

PART NINE: US WITHDRAWAL AND TALIBAN AGAIN
(TALIBAN '2.0' OR TALIBAN '1.0' AGAIN?)

Joe Biden's ascension to Prime minister led to change in Afghan Policy by announcing withdrawal of American Troops by 9/11/21 paving the way for Taliban to recapture Afghan Land and leaving the country in a state of turmoil. Withdrawal of foreign forces from Afghanistan caused the death of so-called democracy and human rights in Afghanistan and potential rise of radical terrorism in the region.

PART SIX: AFGHAN CIVIL WAR (1992-1996)
(MUJAHEDEEN WARLARDS TURN AGAINST EACH OTHER)

This part of The Afghan Plight series focuses on the second part of the civil war which started in 1992 when the Najibullah communist regime began to crumble and USSR dissolved finally. This civil war covers the rivalries between the different Mujahideen factions which paved the way for Taliban to takeover the Afghan Land.

PART FOUR: SOVIET INVASION OF AFGHANISTAN (1979- 1989)
(COLD WAR, PROXY WAR AND THE MUJAHEDEEN)

Here in this part of the timeline, we have covered about the details of Soviet Afghan War which was a result of Cold war and USSR trying to increase its influence over the Afghan land to access its rich mineral resources. This led to the rise of strong anti- soviet sentiments in the country which were backed up by the USA and subsequently the western block and other Middle East Islamic nations converting the whole region into a site of proxy war. And finally, we have covered how Jihad emerged against Soviet in the form of Mujahedeen warlords.

#The #Afghan #Plight
#Soviet #Invasion #of #Afghanistan
#Cold #War #Proxy #War #Mujahedeen

PART 3: AFGHAN- SOVIET RELATIONS (INTERSECTION OF ISLAM AND COMMUNISM)

Here we have thrown light on how the Afghan Soviet relations grew post the Third Anglo Afghan War which resulted in socialist reforms in the country and participation of women in the public domain. These reforms were not really appreciated by the Islamic fundamentalists and especially in the eastern and south- eastern parts of the country.

Representation comes through varied sources and medium. June may come to an end, but Pride is forever and it's time to make our bookshelf and OTT watchlist to be more inclusive and inclined to the actual social reality. The Jaypee Debsoc has tried to come up with some different recommendations in Queer media- literature, Cinema and OTT which are actually free from all the queerbating and pinkwashing agendas as portrayed in Teen dramas, Spanish shows, Mexican Shows and other English shows. Again this list is inexhaustible and we would love to have more recommendations mentioned in the comment section.

FICTION RECOMMENDATIONS

-DreamBoy by Jim Grimsley
-Fun Home: A Family Tragicomic by Alison Bechdel
-Giovanni's room by James Baldwin
-Maurice by E.M. Foster
-As meat loves salt by Maria McCann
-Less by Andrew Sean Greer

NON-FICTION RECOMMENDATIONS

-All boys aren't blue by George M. Johnson
-Epistemology of the Closet (1990)
-Between Men: English Literature and Male Homosocial Desire (1985)

FILM AND TV SERIES RECOMMENDATIONS

-J Edgar
-The Imitation Game (2014)
-Carol (2015)
-Downtown Abbey
-Sense 8

-Fun Home: A Family Tragicomic by Alison Bechdel
-Giovanni's room by James Baldwin
-Maurice by E.M. Foster
-As meat loves salt by Maria McCann
-Less by Andrew Sean Greer

NON-FICTION RECOMMENDATIONS

-All boys aren't blue by George M. Johnson
-Epistemology of the Closet (1990)
-Between Men: English Literature and Male Homosocial Desire (1985)

FILM AND TV SERIES RECOMMENDATIONS

-J Edgar
-The Imitation Game (2014)
-Carol (2015)
-Downtown Abbey
-Sense 8

Representation comes through varied sources and medium. June may come to an end, but Pride is forever and it's time to make our bookshelf and OTT watchlist to be more inclusive and inclined to the actual social reality. The Jaypee Debsoc has tried to come up with some different recommendations in Queer media- literature, Cinema and OTT which are actually free from all the queerbating and pinkwashing agendas as portrayed in Teen dramas, Spanish shows, Mexican Shows and other English shows. Again this list is inexhaustible and we would love to have more recommendations mentioned in the comment section.
